reviews.content: Really disappointed after watching the movie. Story is nothing special same as home alone the movie name also has home alone at the end. Anyways for copying like that a 1 star rating from my side. We like to see new and creative movie not just some copy and recreate.

This entire move made no sense, the writhing was horrendous, and the acting is terrible. But the worst thing about this stinker is the jokes was painfully unfunny. It may have a few chuckles here and there but they're always ruined either by how little sense it makes or tue following scene. Do yourself a favor and skip this film. It's not worth it.

Just Saw This Movie Today & Wasted My 1hr & 33mins. What an complete waste of time
Don't Even Bother Watching itThe Original is Much Much Better
Like we say: Old is Gold
I don't know why these new remakes movies are just rubbish and waste of time0 Stars.

reviews.review_title: Another bad remake. Nothing to see here. Move along now folks.
reviews.content: It's a stinker as I expected. Maybe someday hollywood will have an original idea but not now. Every remake nowadays is just a pale copy of the original. Do yourself a favor and watch the original which will always be a classic.
Don't let your kids watch this. It's not funny in any way. Utter trash trying to cash in on the success of the '90's movies with Culkin.Not even the soundtrack will excite you.

In this, let's call it a light "sequel", the main antagonists are just trying to get something back that the little brat stole from them.The kid is the character in the movie that you hate and the main "antagonists" are the ones you're rooting for. It just leaves you with this bitter feeling the entire time you're watching it.But the biggest thing about this film is that the kid steals an item worth $200,000.. so WHYYYYY didn't they just report it to the police?? This entire film's plot relies on lack of common sense..The only reason I'm giving this a 4 rather than a 1 is because movies like Dragonball, Ace Ventura Jr., and Son of the Mask exist... which are farrrrr worse than this movie.

reviews.review_title: Underestimated the audience on this one, I think
reviews.content: I'm not surprised by the poor rating. I like all these actors and I'm a big fan of Aisling but... despite being an okay story idea in general, this movie unfortunately has nothing new to offer, nothing in it is funny, and is largely ruined by the physical comedy that didn't work at all. If you haven't seen it, don't bother- just tell Aisling you did see it and she was great. Too bad she wasn't in it much.
Looks awful, bad copy of the classic original. Awful actors, and the acting looks awful .Really shouldn't of bothered. Stop remaking films. .........................................................
Whyyy? Just why??? Another nonsense garbage from Disney. Why did they even spend money for it?! Its just unwatchable. It takes olympic effort to find so talentless actors and actresses in Hollywood.

It's difficult to tell who the "good guys" are in this film. Everyone is awful and absolutely moronic. It's hard to feel bad for the parents who are written as people I would consider to stupid to breed. The third home alone, which I thought was bad, is 1,000 times better than this train wreck.

A line in the film sums this movie up "this is garbage, I don't know why they try to remake all the classics, they're never as good as the original".......this line was probably added after they watched the final edit.This may appeal to young children who have never seen the Caulkin classics but as Home Alone and Home Alone 2 are firm holiday favourites around the world this movie will soon be forgotten.

reviews.review_title: Would have given zero stars if I could...
reviews.content: Remake of a great movie... elements are too similar and badly done... not believable and, SPOILER ALERT...The kid stole the doll from the owners of the doll... they have every right to take it back... they have the keys and alarm code... fat kid stole the doll... I rooted for the "thieves"!

Home Sweet Home Alone is not only debatably no different than the third film and the other two reboots but also by far, the worst Disney Plus movie I've seen. Yes, there can be a bit of a timeline years later after the first two Home Alone films. But this movie doesn't care to make anything new out of Home Alone that's actually about the future of Kevin and his family. Instead, this movie regards to be trendy for the children with modern technology and toys. Since this is a reboot to Home Alone, it's no surprise the story is lazily written. The characters are all annoying and their connection is illogical. All we see the "villains" of the movie we see is just break into Max's house just for a valuable doll. Seriously, there are much better ways to make the villains that's not the McKenzies. And the big problem, the humor. I think this has the worst comedy of the year. The movie would supply pop culture references, gross jokes, repeated jokes and a large amount of slapstick. Do I really need to make a recommendation? Just skip this film and go with the first two. Even if the second was the same as the first, at least it was much more tolerable than the other reboots like this one. I thought America The Motion Picture wasn't funny, but this film take the cake as the most unfunny movie of the year. At this rate, Fox should hold down from making anymore Home Alone movies.

reviews.review_title: Just awful - do not waste time watching.
reviews.content: Do yourself and your kids a favour, put on the original instead of this. Even if you have seen it a thousand times, it is still better than this horrible movie. Terrible script that the actors, (most) tried to save but it wasn't possible. My ten year old enjoyed it a bit so if they are desperate to see it, let them watch it alone and save yourself the pain of watching it 😂

Not sure how this got green lit. This is a bad movie, the casting, the script, the plot, even the call backs to the first two movies couldn't have felt more forced. It's a bad as you'd think it would be. Time you'll never get back that couldn't be better spent literally doing anything else.

reviews.review_title: Rich, spoilt kid "STEALS" from the working class
reviews.content: The new plot is a spoilt and wealthy kid who STEALS an expensive artifact and won't give it back. The owners of the artifact are in financial ruin and having to sell up their home to keep their family going. All they want is their doll back, but again the wealthy and well armed rich kid wins over the working class.You can't get behind anyone. The biggest issue is that there is no villain. And arguably if you chose one it would be the boy, not the burglars.You don't like the boy. You don't root for him. At all. He's not likable or motivated by anything other than further greed and selfishness.There is no magic around being home alone. The point of "I made my family disappear" that sentiment of the original that Kevin learns the values of what his family love and connection is and his defending of it, the same as the mom wanting to get home realising she's put work and life ahead of family is also lost here.

As a huge fan of Home Alone 1&2, this production has been a little bit of a rollercoaster for me. I was initially excited when I heard they were reviving the franchise, then I was disappointed when I found out Macaulay wasn't involved. I was still excited to see it, but about 10 minutes in, I realized that this was going to be a terrible movie. First off, I don't know if Archie Yates had to beat out a bunch of kids for the role, or if he was their first choice, but he was one of the most unlikable protagonists that I've ever seen. He had zero charisma and his personality made me root against him the entire movie. I don't who the "good guy" is supposed to be in this movie. The McKenzies are too nice to be villains, but too dumb to be heroes. Regardless, when they are subjected to the booby traps, the slapstick is more sad than funny. You don't want the obnoxious brat to win, so you just want all the "hijinks" to be over as soon as possible. Unfortunately this movie will probably put an end to the Home Alone franchise.

reviews.review_title: Good People Getting Tortured Is Not Funny
reviews.content: It's so infuriating to watch a film where two hard working people are trying to make a living but are forced to do horrible things and then get, literally, tortured by an ignorant child. I laughed like twice, one out of pure cringe but admittedly, once out of actual comedy.The acting is bad, the sets are bad and some of the camera work looks weirdly amateur at times.All in all, just watch the original and save yourself the pain.

The flaw was the initial concept. The "bad guys" had a just, almost noble purpose and the "good guy" was an annoying brat. Not funny. Not enjoyable. The film elicited one smile but that was all. Not worth the time.

I knew it wouldn't be as good as the original, it is after all a remake of a classic film which is still as popular and enjoyable today as it was upon release, but even I expected a tiny bit more.In an attempt to differentiate itself from the original, the main child character is a bratty kid that steals a valuable antique doll, and two adults try to get it back. Immediately that makes it lack the same appeal as the original, which was a kid fighting back against robbers trying to steal his family's possessions.Everything about it feels forced. Whereas the original was a "normal" family film with genuinely funny and charming characters and moments, this one feels like it's desperately trying to be funny, and it just doesn't work.There wasn't a single bit of genuinely funny, nor fun, moments. I guess some children might enjoy the fart jokes and silliness, but that isn't what makes the original Home Alone so enjoyable; it didn't have to rely on cheap gimmicks or jokes. While the original was silly in places, it was on a solid base of a strong story and characters, and it wasn't trying to force laughs.As Chris Columbus, the director of the original, said so accurately "it's a waste of time as far as I'm concerned. What's the point? I'm a firm believer that you don't remake films that have had the longevity of Home Alone. You're not going to create lightning in a bottle again. It's just not going to happen. So why do it? It's like doing a paint-by-numbers version of a Disney animated film - a live-action version of that. What's the point? It's been done. Do your own thing. Even if you fail miserably, at least you have come up with something original."

I hate this dumb lying movie so much, because there is No Macaulay came back!!!!!! I never gonna have kids.Archie Yates is a good English actor.I thought Archie Yates makes an American accent, but BS!!!!!!!!!

I honestly tried to watch the entire movie, but I only made through to about 20 minutes in before deciding the movie was entirely too cringe-worthy to give any more time to.Also, in this one, the kid who is "protecting" his home is essentially the criminal...I love Asling Bea but I'm sorry to see her in such a terrible movie. I would still say give it a watch and see if you like it, but honestly it's full of tired references and ultimately leaves me feeling like it was time and money wasted. Don't waste yours.

I've had explosive diarrhea that was more enjoyable than this movie. The original movie made you cheer for Kevin. This movie had me hating this spoiled kid and his toilet of a family. Disney should just delete this morning and pretend it was never made.Do yourself a favor and eat bad chicken instead of watching this movie.

New Kid but the plot was different that ended well, they had a few good comedians on here and they brought back an old character from the 1st two movies which was cool to see. This whole movie was wacky because it really could have been one way but it spiraled into bizarre happenings which made it decent.

Dan Mazer, who directed this, is the production partner of Sacha Baron Cohen and co-wrote Borat and Bruno with him. The writers of this were Mikey Day from Saturday Night Live and that show's head writer Streeter Seidell. If you've seen the quality of what's airing at 11:30 on Saturday nights lately, this movie should be no surprise, as it's a soulless approximation of something that some people once loved shoved in your face.It has Rob Delaney and Ellie Kemper as a couple trying to keep the holidays happening despite money issues, the strange antique doll they have and the kid next door named Max (Archie Yates from Jojo Rabbit) who gets left home and battles them when they try to sneak into his house and get the doll back because they think he stole it. It doesn't even get Home Alone right as with the couple being good people, we don't want to see the pranks painfully stop their invasion.Seidell is remaking Inspector Gadget and SpaceCamp as well. It's Christmas and I shouldn't be upset about these types of things.At least Devin Ratray gets some work here and plays Officer Buzz McCallister, who is, of course, Kevin's brother.Chris Columbus, the director of the original, said of this movie "Nobody got in touch with me about it, and it's a waste of time as far as I'm concerned. What's the point? I'm a firm believer that you don't remake films that have had the longevity of Home Alone. You're not going to create lightning in a bottle again. It's just not going to happen. So why do it? It's like doing a paint-by-numbers version of a Disney animated film - a live-action version of that. What's the point? It's been done. Do your own thing. Even if you fail miserably, at least you have come up with something original."

reviews.review_title: If there's anything redeeming, I must have missed it.
reviews.content: Ah yes, the film that begs the question "what if they made another unnecessary Home Alone movie but completely failed to understand what made the first two films good?". Let's make the kid the most unlikeable character and let's have the audience sympathize with the home intruders! It's almost like this is the 4th one of these in a row that absolutely didn't need to be made.My only hope is that the adults who knew better but made the movie anyway (both cast and crew) get the blame for how terrible this is. We as a people are not historically kind to child actors but we know two things about Archie Yates: he was brilliant in JoJo Rabbit so he CAN act, and it isn't his fault that the screenplay is just utter trash. Hopefully this will in no way hurt his future acting career.

I don't get all the hate. I started to watch the film expecting nothing much, but I was pleasantly surprised. The film is a good attempt on a classic story. There were plenty of funny bits, original jokes and references to the originals to make it interesting. I give it a thumbs up.

reviews.review_title: The first Home Alone film that had me routing for the invaders
reviews.content: As pretty much every other review has said, this is not comparable to the original Home Alone films. Even the third film had bad guys you wanted to lose. But here, they've put so much development into the McKenzies - Ellie Kemper and Rob Delaney - that Nick Frosts love child (Archie Yates) is left as more of an annoyance than some avenging angel defending his home.If anything, this film could have benefitted from Simon Pegg writing the script; at least you'd know there was supposed to be zombies in the film. The rest of Maxs family are vapid, just like Rob McKenzies brothers family, reminiscent of National Lampoons Christmas Vacation. Even the presence of SNL stalwart Kenan Thompson can't bring it up.The premise is much the same as previous iterations; extended family goes on holiday, forget the son who wishes to be on their own and shenanigans ensue. But given all the family development, the house defence gets barely any time. The cameos by a series alum gets about as much time!Maybe a good Disney+ content filler, but the series is continuing its quality decline.

reviews.review_title: Total Garbage. Leave the Classics Alone Disney!
reviews.content: Gross and distasteful excuse of a classic family movie. Growing up and watching the original with my family has always been a tradition and we were skeptical when it was announced. We watched the first trailer and we realized it's worse then we thought. Disney keeps taking original good movies and turning them into garbage. DISNEY LEAVE MOVIES AS THEY ARE.

Did Home Alone 4 not teach you anything? Nostalgia =/= Reboot. We love the old and hate to see them ruined by greed. It's 2021 - be creative. Give current generations something to feel nostalgic about 20 years from now.

Overall, not completely terrible. Fans of the first two are always going to hate it, due to the uniqueness and story telling of them, at the time. Many reviews on here are probably from people who haven't actually watched it, and just want to complain. Is far better than the 3rd, 4th and 5th installments.Aisling Bea was far under used, and Rob Delaney was a bit annoying. Randomly the dad of the main kid didn't really care his son was left at behind. That aside, there is an enjoyable film in there.The lad in main role was actually good in the role, I know that people will hate him just because of the British accent.There's fun along the way, the normal slapstick you expect. Younger people will certainly enjoy it, sit back and just enjoy it for what it is.

reviews.review_title: If you like TRASH. This movie is for you
reviews.content: Pure trash. Why can't we give a negative rating?If we could? This would get -10/10.Truly one of the worst movies made in the last 15 years. Worse than most Steven Seagal movies.
Not sure why the bad reviews! It's funny, it even made me laugh which is hard. It's a good family movie! A good twist on the original and would recommend to all families 🙂

This movie is terrible! I thought Ellie Camper couldn't do worst than Kimmy Schmidt (Titus saved that), but she did! The protagonist kid shouldn't be allowed to perform again ever! It wasn't a remake or a remastered copy of Home Alone, it was -at most- a low budget parody cosplay with extremely bad taste. Nothing saves it.

The "villains'" are not really bad. They were taken advantage of by the boy and his mom and really are just trying to save there home and care for there family. And the left alone boy is not relatable or even a particularly good actor. I find him and his whole family annoying, selfish, and don't care about them as characters. Really not a good Disney movie. It made me so upset about the storyline and horrible premise I walked away in disgust.

This is not the movie I grew up. I sucked it up and watched it for my brothers but I regretted it the minute the main kid popped on the screen. You can't expect us to root for a kid that's a brat. The " Thieves" are just poor people and just..well let's say it trying and failing on every level (family, kids, life, stealing stuff back..)it's just painful to watch at times. It's so sad people keep greenlighting these movies..please stop!!

We were hoping this would work...but sadly it did not.This movie focuses more on the "bad guys" who aren't actually bad but desperate.Not much focal point on Max or his mom's journey back to him.The only memorable part for me are the Mcallister references.Trailer looked great...movie was not. Fell flat in many areas.I truly hope my kids forget about this iteration and stick to the original
2.

I watched this with an eight-year-old a week out from Christmas and can happily report that she enjoyed every minute of it. Look, this isn't Home Alone 2: Lost in New York (my favourite) or the original or even the unfairly-maligned Home Alone 3, but it isn't quite as terrible as some of the reviews I've read would suggest. Yes, the premise has been done before and better, and there's an English kid in Chicago and the quote-unquote bad guys are different to any of the franchise's bad guys before, but there are still some enjoyable scenes in this movie, including Kevin's brother Buzz in a cameo scene as a local police officer. Hearing the opening strains of 'Somewhere in my Memory' never fails to provoke Christmas nostalgia, too.

reviews.review_title: Man! I could have watched this on Christmas!
reviews.content: Do I want to say Christmas classic? I don't know about that, but I felt it had all the stuff that makes for a heartwarming Christmas tale.Its not going to beat the original, but it makes up for Home Alone 3, right? I did love the connection this movie does make to the original. Those were some cool moments.Funny thing is, I don't necessarily see this new kid Max as being less hostile to his robbers Pam and Jeff. I was expecting the violence to be toned down because of the complaints Home Alone got for how Kevin went at it on the Wet Bandits, a duo of thieves trying to rob Kevin's house and seemed willing to kill him to do it, mind you. At least Pam and Jeff had a very justifiable and very Christmas perfect reason to need to break into Max's house. Wow, what a pile of garbage... As a person born in 1981, making me perfectly aged to enjoy the classic Home Alone, I most likely had higher expectations than most. But also being a Disney fan, I was excited to see what they could do with this franchise. But man o' man, what a rotten one here.It's not the cast, it's not the budget, it's not even the problem of remaking a classic. Here's the problem...the story is trash. You identify more with the poor couple being assaulted the entire movie. I mean talk about tone deaf. They average family who will likely watch this movie are the age of the couple in the movie with their kids being they age they were when seeing the original. My 7 year old basically started crying because the evil kid kept hurting these nice people simply trying to save their home. In the current climate in the States this movie is simply stupid. Obscenely rich kid steals from middle class family losing their home. Not funny. Annoying kid assaults them over and over as they try to reclaim stolen property. Again not funny. Finally movie results with...oh guess what, he didn't take it, it was someone else...stupid. Horrible movie. I never write reviews but this made me so angry I really want to discourage people from watching it.I honestly feel bad for Ellie Kemper, Rob Delaney, and Kenan Thompson for being associated with this movie. All very funny people and did their best with the material but a terrifically unfunny premise.I will give them props for including a bunch of Easter eggs of the original and bringing Buzz back. Other than that, please Disney delete this movie, forget that it ever happened and move on.

reviews.review_title: An unnecessary sequel that tarnishes the legacy of the original!
reviews.content: If only sequels were easy, right? Home Sweet Home Alone is a sequel of sorts to the classic Home Alone series. Why would one make a modern day adaptation of an all-time classic? Maybe to appeal to the current generation of kids and give them ideas on how to target intruders or just to mint money. Thank god this was an direct to OTT release because this would have bombed big time if it was not.Set during Christmas, the Mercer family are on their way to Tokyo for the holidays. They leave a young sleepy kid, Max Mercer behind; all alone at home. Enter Jeff & Pam; parents who are struggling financially. They suspect that Max has stolen a prized doll from their open house and try to take it back by breaking and entering. And yes, Max's mom rushes back from Tokyo.If you are adapting the movie for the current generation, make some significant changes at least. The major change we see here is the motivation of the intruders. They are not thieves. They just want what is theirs. This is a typical Disney move; everyone has a backstory; in this case a sob story. There is also the accent. Basically, mommy Mercer & Max Mercer are British. Yes, that makes a lot of difference!Max Mercer is played by Archie Yates of Jojo Rabbit fame. He is a kid alright but it is quite difficult not to compare him to Macaulay Culkin. The two intruders are played by Ellie Kemper & Rob Delaney. Both usually have excellent comic timing. But the slapstic routine doesn't work for them. Nevertheless, it is always fun to watch them in action.We also get a peek into what McCallister is doing now with Buzz McCallister's character making an appearance as a cop.Home Sweet Home Alone is a failed attempt at recreating an all-time holiday classic for the current generation. The thing is; the original is an evergreen classic. It works for every generation. Disney, you are better than this!

reviews.review_title: The worst movie that insults your intelligence
reviews.content: The movie is not funny. The plots doesn't make sense. The worst part of the movie is that: it teaches kids to play cruel tricks and hurt good people. The "villains" in this movie are hard working middle class parents who thought their precious doll was stolen by boy from a rich family. All they wanted to do is to get the doll back to save their home. They are the average parents who are victimized by our economic system, because the father lost his job. Why would any descent people with slightest intelligence want to hurt them with the cruel and deadly traps in a movie like this? I certainly wouldn't let my kids watch the film. It tells them a cruel lesson about family, love, and society in general. Even though the misunderstanding was cleared in the end, the middle class / "villains" could have been dead many times im this movie. Only a low IQ person without any heart could write a story like this!

Wow, after seeing what was already hated before I watched it, I have to say that Home Sweet Home Alone is a complete fail of the source material. The writing, the direction, the characters, the performances, they were all waste, good actors given such a terrible script. 31 years after the holiday classic of a kid foiling two robbers was a cinematic milestone, and after four sequels that failed to surpass it, we have one that I have so little respect for and the worst one since Home Alone 4, this is the 6th film in the franchise and the first Disney after Disney brought FOX, so from out of nowhere, we got the Home Alone movie nobody asked for.Max Mercer, a mischievous and resourceful young boy, has been left behind while his family is in Japan for the holidays. So when a married couple attempting to reactive a priceless heirloom sets their sights on the Mercer family's home, it's up to Max to protect it from the trespassers, and he will do whatever it takes to keep them out.So that's Home Sweet Home Alone in a nutshell. Fixing what isn't broken is a tired old cliche by this point for Disney, first they remake and ruin most of their cherished animated classics, then they buy Star Wars and ruin for the fans, and now they will anger the Home Alone fans with this crap. This was just painful to get through.This is a reboot to be honest and rebooting movies in this day and age is more than likely to be absolutely unnecessary. Considering that the original movie was already a classic that didn't need to be remade and also the fact the franchise stopped being good after the first two movies, as the sequels ended up being poorly-received amongst fans.Here, the humor in this film sucks and even the traps aren't quite as funny or as original. There's even parts where the robbers are getting hit in the groin and or having sharp objects on their feet, and some of the traps appear to be dangerous.The other characters aside from Max are also bland and unlikable too. The actors did a terrible job, but I do see that they are talented in some way.So Home Sweet Home Alone finds new ways to fail and fall flat on it's face and it's a mess for the Home Alone fans. Aside from Buzz's cameo, there's nothing in this movie I would recommend to you. If you have Disney+, skip it. If you do have Disney+ don't bother paying for it. It's just another reminder you can watch the original and have a Merry Christmas or Happy Holidays. Not the worst Home Alone movie I've ever considering the fourth film was a complete fail, but this one came VERY close to beating it. Don't bother if you are a fan of the original Home Alone.2/10.

Unlike most people I had no issues with this movie being made as the plot is timeless, the problem however is that your left the whole time feeling sorry for the 'villains'. The storyline of a kid beating up bad guys is as old as time but this film fails to deliver the basic necessity that the audience need to actually have a reason to dislike the baddies.You don't want to see a nice married couple on the verge of financial ruin, after thinking they've had something stole from them getting beat up.

In 1990, a warm-hearted slapstick film called "Home Alone" was a surprise blockbuster hit, breaking the record for the highest-grossing live-action comedy, nominated for a Golden Globe, and followed by three sequels. This quasi-remake, "Home Sweet Home Alone," keeps the basic storyline about a child accidentally left behind who defends his home from would-be burglars with complicated contraptions. It even includes an actor from the original, and a child slapping his cheeks in astonishment, the original's iconic image. But it misses the key elements that made both the slapstick and the sentiment of the 1990 version appealing. Yates' nicely understated delivery is not used as effectively here as it was in "JoJo Rabbit." To get away from his extended family, Max goes to the garage and climbs into the back seat of the car to watch Road Runner cartoons (a clear inspiration for all of the "Home Alone" movies). Instead of the cartoonishly bumbling robbers of the original film, who made it easy to enjoy their downfall, the "home sweet home" is just as important to this film's intruders, a married couple played by the endlessly likeable Ellie Kemper (Pam) and Rob Delaney (Jeff). They are under a lot of financial stress because Jeff has lost his job as a data migration expert. The way he and Pam refer to "the cloud" as the reason he is out of work is probably the movie's best joke. Jeff's obnoxious show-off brother Hunter (Timothy Simons, underused) and his wife and son arrive to make Jeff feel even worse about not providing for his family. As ridiculous as it is for Pam and Jeff to try to break into Max's house to retrieve the doll, we want them to get it back so they can stay in their home. And as ridiculous as it is for Max to set up booby traps that would impress both Rube Goldberg and Navy Seals, we can understand that he feels vulnerable and is trying to do what he can to stay safe. The original film had a genuinely touching subplot of family reconciliation to add tenderness to the over-the-top pratfalls. This one only gestures feebly at the kind of cozy connections that made the conclusion of the earlier film comforting and even meaningful.

reviews.review_title: John Hughes is turning in his grave
reviews.content: What made the Home Alone and Home Alone 2 so good was the casting, the acting, the jokes, the heartfelt spirit, and, of course, the classic John Williams score. Home Sweet Home Alone was downright appallingly bad.I thought the premise was in very poor taste. A family that is struggling financially believes their rare doll (the solution to their financial woes) to have been stolen by a rich brat. This poor husband and wife spend much of the movie getting punished by this annoying kid. I was cringing at how tone deaf this plot was. Let's laugh at poor people who have to go to crazy lengths just to keep their home. Meanwhile, the rich annoying kid has to sleep in a BMW?The acting was horrible. I can't believe Ellie Kemper (Unbreakable Kimmy Schmidt) did this movie. They should've given it a different name like Homeless for the Holidays to complete the tone deaf narrative. This film doesn't deserve the Home Alone title in its name.

reviews.review_title: Stop trying to compare it to the originals.

They will never replace first two ever even part 3 was better. All I got to say is it was not funny at all. They need to give up on home alone quit while they are ahead.

This could've been a masterpiece with the most popular actors ever and it'll have got hated, they were never ever going to get this film to be well received.The original is class, but it's there, will always be there, you can like new things linked to the past. Otherwise they'll not even try and we miss out on entertainment that has nostalgia in it whilst being modern, stop being such misery's, new is different it doesn't affect the old classic, it's so dumb saying just watch the old ones.The film starts a bit slow but as soon as the physical stuff kicks in it's genuinely enjoyable and it's quite sweet in places, way better than I thought it'd be, way better than the other 3 home alones made after the big 2. Ellie kemper is the star and glue that holds it together, whilst the dad (rob) was poorly cast and with a funnier more natural actor would've been better. It's genuinely entertaining. The hate was always going to exist even if they'd have won Oscars. The nods to the original like the music and Kevin's older brother were great.The only issue really was being slow to get going and casting, the kid was an awful choice, no charisma, no humour and failed to portray any emotion, going "yes" after traps worked even felt forced, if they try again and I hope they do work harder on focus groups to get a hood kid actor . Just stop being WB.It's enough to see a old story that getting worse every time.

reviews.review_title: Glad I watched it, and the kids loved it
reviews.content: I loved the originals (1 and 2), the sequels were not good.. But this reboot worked for me. It was fun, cheesy and very Disney.I probably won't ever watch it again, but I'll have trouble stopping my kids!
Cute remake but they could have just rang the doorbell and asked for the doll back. Especially once they believed the boy was with his granny.................

Everything about this movie sucks. The kid, the traps, the characters, the "burglars." First of all, the kid here is extremely punch-able, he's way too overpowered, has way too many high tech items to beat up the villains, and is a horrible person overall. What's his motive though? The married couple is trying to take a valuable doll that the kid "stole." Yeah, not very good.The humor is also extremely bad. It's awkwardly unfunny and stupid. This entire script felt like it was written by a guy who had to ask his kids what slang words are popular, and what a "Fortnite" is. There is a joke at the beginning of a movie where the family is watching an 'Angels with filthy souls' remake. (The fake movie in the original Home Alone with Johnny and Snakes) The dad then says "Why do they remake the classics, they're never as good as the original." Haha. Good one Disney. Meta does not equal funny.The traps as well are absolutely awful. It's just slapstick repeats of the original ones but modernized to cause more carnage. The kid puts a VR headset onto one of the burglars, and makes it look like he's in more danger than he really is.Finally, this movie just doesn't work. What makes the original Home Alone movies so good, is that they came out just before cell phones became a thing. If this scenario were to happen in real life, it would be solved instantly. Overall, this is just a garbage movie made by Disney to rake in the most amount of money by trying as little as possible, and pandering to the fans of the originals. Buzz is in this as a cop and is absolutely insufferable. He's a dumb failure of a cop that is only here to connect both movies and talk about Kevin in one scene.Wouldn't recommend this to anyone unless you're a fan of bad movies. 1/10 would give 0 if I could.

I wanted to enjoy this because the original two were a big part of my childhood. As an adult I still watch them at Christmas without fail as they remind me of time with family who've all long since passed.This new version lacks the charm and warmth of the original. Even by bringing back XXXX as a nod to what came before it, it really wasn't worthwhile. I never leave reviews or rate films but this absolutely deserved both.

This movie is absolutely stupid. The plot is absurd.
