I was ready to hate this the moment they announced its release but it's no as bad as I expected and chuckled a few times and was pretty pleased when Buzz made his appearance.You can't beat the original. I didn't expect it to. But isn't so bad if you're just watching for fun.

Home Sweet Home Alone is a Disney movie and a remake of the original with a modern twist. In this case a kid named Max Mercer played by Archie Yates is the villain left behind by his family. He presumably stole a valuable heirloom that belonged to Ellie Kemper and Rob Delaney as they try to break in and steal it back. The story is the same as the original with all the chaos with a happy ending. The story connects with the original with Buzz McCallister (Devin Ratray) who portrays a security cop for the McCallister Security Company. Keenan Thompson acts the real estate agent who tries to help sell the out of work McKenzie's residence. The cast also includes Aisling Bea as Max's mother, Timothy Simons and the beautiful Ally Maki as the uncle and aunt as well as a brief stint by Chris Parnell and Pete Holmes. Overall it wasn't the best and I don't see myself watching it again, but it was an ok family movie that the kids might like.

This was terrible with some nostalgia thrown in to try distracting you. And they try making the criminals relatable for some reason which just makes you feel bad for them when the antics happen against them. I don't understand why they'd want to redo old movies really badly.

reviews.review_title: As a Stand-alone movie it's okay
reviews.content: Okay, so I'm not going to compare this to the original 1990 as it's just unfair as nothing will ever be able to replace or remake the originalAs a stand-alone movie for the young generation that may have not seen the original (or even care about making comparisons) it's okay.It has some very entertaining parts for kids to laugh at, unfortunately as an adult I didn't find myself laughing that much, in fact I was cringing more than anything at some of the acting and dialogue - not sure how the characters were cast - I imagine they were trying to distance the characters as much as possible from the original, which is where (in my opinion) failed. It's clear that they wanted to have this movie stand on its own yet brought in so many references to the original. Therefore for me it felt very very clunky in partsI feel that they could have made this so much better but the casting and dialogue just didn't sit well with me.

reviews.review_title: Movie misses the point of the franchise
reviews.content: The film, overall, wasn't the worst in the franchise, as it contained plenty of self aware humour, some good jokes and even a hilarious cameo from Buzz McCallister that gives the audience an insight into the original casts future lives. Nevertheless, it completely misses the point of the films. The enjoyable aspect of the movies is, watching an evil duo that threaten the life and safety of the child, get their comeuppance. However, the break in was instigated by a nice couple that were only trying to regain stolen property to save their family home. The kid was attacking them based upon miscommunication, which leads to a nice couple getting brutally attacked by a psycho kid. Instead of laughing at the duo's pain, I inwardly cringed and felt sorry for them, which essentially just ruins the film. And instead of the couple being arrested for breaking and entering, or the kid being arressted for assault, they all just laughed at the miscommunication and spent future christmases together like besties, which of course, is just ridiculous. The one man, Jeff, likely got brain damage from the pool ball injuries and the woman, Pam, was set on FIRE. But apparently that leads to bygones? I see they are trying to aim for a feel good ending for everyone but when mixed with such violence it just leaves a sour note.

Should have change the child actor he looks so grumpy and evil all the time. Home alone cast should be funny and innocent not evil. In this movie you actually feel sorry for the intruders and you want the main actor too hurt, because he is the evil one.

reviews.review_title: Unlikeable lead character and unfortunate story plot.
reviews.content: The boy is obnoxious, rude and vile. I realized 10 minutes into this movie that he was unlikebable.(Wanting to talk to Mom while she was on the phone). The bad guys are the victims and I only wanted them to retrieve the stolen item taken by the vile food motivated kid. Had hopes for this movie but it went south very early.

reviews.review_title: Finally, a Worthy Addition to the Home Alone Franchise!!!
reviews.content: Yes, I actually liked the movie. I'm giving it a high rating, so go ahead and be a troll and give me a thumbs down and tell me my review isn't helpful because yall don't agree with me.When I saw the trailer, I did roll my eyes and didn't care much for the kid, but when I watched it, he grew on me a little bit. This new installment in the Home Alone series (We're up to the 6th one now) is a LOT better then the previous two films, but it's still not as good as the original. To me, this feels like the true 'Home Alone 3' because one of the original stars from the originals makes an appearance, and they use the classic John Williams theme music. I was intrigued by the story, and it managed to make me feel nostalgic, especially when they play 'Somewhere in my Memory' This time, we get to know the burglars, and come to care for them and why they're doing the robbing.Meet Pam and Jeff McKenzie, a down-on-their-luck couple who have to sell their house because it's getting too expensive to live there. They haven't told their children yet. During an open house, they run into 10-year old Max Mercer and his mom, Carol. They're only there because Max needed to stop and use the bathroom. On the way out, Max notices an ugly doll with an upside-down face. Max and Jeff have words over it and they finally leave. That night, Jeff researches the doll and finds that it's extremely rare and worth a lot. The only problem is that the doll is now missing.The next day, Max's family is on the way to the airport to Japan, and of course, Max gets left home alone. He reacts the same way Kevin McCallister did, then he gets bored and lonely. Pam and Jeff assume that Max took the doll, and track him to his house and try to get it back. Max unfortunately misunderstands their intentions and begins his battle plan to strike back against the burglars.I honestly feel that this movie is worthy of the Home Alone name. It gave me nostalgic feels like the first two, it has the classic John Williams music and it gave me a few laughs. I wouldn't mind watching it again. There are other easter eggs and nods to the original classic, too. If you love the franchise, I would highly recommend HOME SWEET HOME ALONE!!!

Okay so this movie wasn't awful but it completely rewrites the premise of Hone Alone!In the original, Kevin was a hero defending his house against two burglars. If they wanted to be successful, they should of gotten McCauley Culkin back. A fresh story that revolves around him and his son with the older villains.Not sure what the point of this film was unfortunately, could have been so much better.

reviews.review_title: I really wanted to watch a bad movie.
reviews.content: Some events happend and they were all so forgetful. They tried but no way near those two originals. The kid and the adults tried so hard to create that practical pranks funny but they were all so cringy. The whole thing was just displeasing.

reviews.review_title: This is a crap wrapped like the perfect gift for Christmas
reviews.content: It's sad and pathetic how a movie that takes advantage of people's collective memory can't even do it in the dumbest and most simplistic way, it doesn't even try. Home sweet home alone (2021) remake of Home alone directed by chris columbus, (1990), is a movie that drops from the premise; "a spoiled little boy and only son of a single and not at all nice mom obsessed with work has to stop two moronic idiots who thought he had a valuable maggifin for the resolution of a conflict that nobody is interested in getting into their house". From the script, this movie is total crap, but more importantly, because it makes no sense, we shouldn't care so much about it, at least not enough to watch it once, and never see it again in the little or much time we have to live; being that both the original and the sequel are more than Christmas classics of all the times, you can see for miles what immediately makes it a clumsy insult, full of commercial brands and out-of-place jokes. Every character that appears here is either a poorly made copy of the original, or a malicious modern reinterpretation of it, but hiding under ideals of intent and insertion. What's worse, having a bad character who wants to give himself a better life than he has on his own merits, or a brainless person who tries to give free rein to his means just for a selfish situation that could have been solved in the right way more than easily, and even more having technological tools at hand?.... In short, it's mixing the first and the third movie, or rather making a pseudo remake of the third movie with elements of the first one so that the audience feels it was worth watching, which leaves down to the ground any desire to recommend it not only to a casual audience, but even to any child fan of the last seasons of south park or merry melodies. It assembles a bunch of comic actors with nothing to do, with a script written in a day and a half or two, along with all the technical luxuries that disney can offer to two sloppy directors whose success resides in writing for films that are not tied to a conventional plot and the result is absurd in a bad way, a mockery of the comedy of the original, a spit of red-green that thinks it is more imaginative and aggressive, but fails in so many ways, it is simply unbelievable that it has come out at all. This film makes everything that followed after 1992 look like a masterpiece. Undoubtedly a dreadful remake, which I thank all the saints it is on disney plus, and not disney channel or the like so my family or someone close to me can easily watch it.2.5/10.

This movie was a atrocious failure. From choice and actors to the storyline from beginning to end. Disney should fire whoever okayed this movie. Someone was either trying to destroy Disney or the legacy of home alone created by Macaulay Culkin which was a brilliant first and second movie. You did not need to remake classics unless you found someone in this day and age just as good as a Macauley Culkin. You didn't you failed Disney stop failing your fans it is not about what you want it's about what the people want. You're going to end up like blackberry!

The movie was good up until they had the boy dress in a girls dress!!!! WHY? Why ruin a kids movie? I was watching it with my 9 year old son, and he said that was so stupid, and we turned it off right after that. Disney thinks it's normal to do that, but it's not!!!!

reviews.review_title: There is nothing to like about this movie or characterss
reviews.content: The first home alone everybody bullies Kevin so you feel bad for him and empathize with him and then he wishes everyone gone and then it's kind of a fun movie.This movies there's too much focus on the people breaking in and their friends, you never spend any time at all with his actual parents or family and the kid is the one annoying people so he is instantly dislikeable and all he does is complain. There's absolutely nothing to like in this movie.

reviews.review_title: That's... not how you make a home alone movie
reviews.content: The kid protagonist in this movie is atrocious, and not only that, but it doesn't show us that he's learned that his behavior is not good.This film makes the so-called "burglars" sympathetic characters, while they make the kid an annoying little prick that you just want him to get hurt. I don't see any enjoyment watching two people (who didn't do anything bad after all) getting tortured by an eight year old - hell, it might even be cringe worthy for little kids. It's generally not a film that has received positive criticism from the majority of the viewers and critics, and I can see why. The 10 star reviews here are just some rare exceptions, or maybe people who don't know what they're saying - I personally found no enjoyment while watching this.Just don't do watch it - the plot doesn't make any sense and the characters are either dull or idiotic. You may enjoy the traps in the third act (Maybe, although I doubt since the burglars are quite sympathetic here) along with some jokes here and there, but that's it. Just watch the first three movies - I find them a lot better than this cringe worthy sequel.

Disney needs to come up with new ideas and leave perfect classics alone . This was so so bad . Thick British accent in America . Cheesy acting . Toned down woke nonsense . Don't waste you time watching .

reviews.review_title: This is word than anything pass 4-
reviews.content: This was terrible, the jokes, everything was just bad, the acting was like a adult film in a Disney Film bad, the lack of funny jokes, the lack of new original cool traps, the bad guys where dumb and slow and not cool like the original two where.. Home alone 3 should've not been called Home Alone, it was cool, it was a new cast and a new location, and had a few references here and there, we don't talk about 4-6. This adaptation was terrible and shouldn't be praised, Disney can do better than this not a cash grab. This movie barely made 4 million on Disney plus so far.

This movie is a joke... No idea why they even made this... Nothing good about this, and the plot of home alone is a joke as well.. If you compare this to 1990 classic you would probably vote this movie a negative 10...
This movie is just a weird semi sequel / remake of the one from the 90s, just so bad and boring. No personality on any of the characters, predictable and boring.

When we got together for a family movie night we thought the new home alone movie would be a great way to get into the Christmas spirit, but when everyone leaves not half way through the movie you know there's a problem. It Basically takes everything that made home alone great and threw it in the trash. Takes away the comedy, characters are basic and not relatable. You don't feel bad for the kid you end up feeling bad for the people breaking in, and watching what they have to go through just to get back something that was stolen from them is painful and sad not the movie I was looking for the holidays.

reviews.review_title: Not as bad as people are saying!
reviews.content: I think people leaving nasty comments need to realise this film wasn't made for you and your 30+ self!Of course it isn't going to be as good as the originals to us!But my kids enjoyed it and it's a decent family movie!

Worst home alone movie ever. Even star cast was below average. It's a total waste of time. Very little attention paid on character building and plot was nonsensical. 90 s home alone movies were much better.

Disney, you took a great movie and ruined it.The acting is mediocre, and the story is woeful. This movie is terrible in every way.If you want to watch a Christmas movie, watch the original instead of this abomination.

reviews.review_title: What else could you expect from another unnecessary remake/reboot /sequel?
reviews.content: Although it is not the first (failed) attempt to revive the now classic Christmas comedy, here the most dissonant thing is that unlike the original plot, the "thieves" are not such, but a married couple with financial problems and desperate to recover what is theirs, therefore it is not funny to see them subjected to so much torture by a really unpleasant child (the only good thing is that at least this protagonist does not correspond to the physical Hollywood stereotypes).

reviews.review_title: One of the worst movies ever made
reviews.content:
Acting with a capital A. So bad and cringey. No talent actors who were presentational and had 0 ounce of human truth. No human emotion. Catherine O'Hara deserves and Oscar compared to this hot mess. The mom and the flight attendant scene was the worst, zero compassion or real genuine feeling. Fakest movie I've ever seen. Come on Disney! You deserve these flops
you're getting because this is terrible. Who is running the show? You could've at least tried to put an ounce of emotion or effort in this, but you had zero. Terrible jokes, a D movie at best, some of the worst acting I've ever seen. Sorry, but it's really that bad. Fire this director and the casting director and blacklist the writers. CEO of Disney should be suspended without pay.

reviews.review_title: Not as bad as number 4 or 5 however still not Amazing unfortunately
reviews.content: I loved all those pranks made buy the kid that was quite funny. The boy was very enjoyable to watch on screen as he did a very good job for a kid. The overall story though for me needs to have a better script, although you will find some charisma in there. The music was pretty stale. The kid himself was likeable. The police was quite dumb and didn't arrest them even though the kid was telling him to do so he should of said it louder or more times I guess. The family are hardly in the movie. I didn't really care that the other family just wanted there dull back I thought it was a bit unnecessary and didn't really add much to the overall story. It has a joyful ending though. Overall disappointed.Rating stands at 4.8/10.

What a stupid, nonsensical remake nobody asked for and nobody wants or needs. Almost everything is wrong with that film. One raises sympathy with the villains and wishes they finally get the chance to spank that little brat. I don't feel anything for him and his parents. Kevin's mom suffered mentally and physically getting home to her son whereas this discount mother struggles with discount John Candy in a plane sitting next to her about.....nothing. Not one single joke made me laugh. I don't know who this characters are and after 10 minutes or so I really don't care anymore. Why aren't "the villains" just waiting for the family to come home from vacation to get that puppet back? Why should I want to see discount Kevin fight against a couple who are the only ones with understandable motivations? I could go on, but I think it's clear what's my point here. Another classic pop culture flick ruined by Disney. Spank that brat. Spank Disney.

This film is terrible, the child actor is a bad actor and his character is just a spoilt brat, the rest of the acting isn't really that good either. If you want to watch home alone then watch home alone.
Plastic acting and awful script, first two are great but this is poor, buzz should be embarrassed, reworking parts of originals but not well, save the time and help grass grow you will thank me.

reviews.review_title: Made deck the halls look like citizen Kane.
reviews.content: There was one good part. The end credits.Bad Christmas movies are my guilty pleasure, but the "so bad it's good" type. This is not this type. I won't watch this again.Some of the slapstick was mildly funny, but doesn't warrant a repeat viewing.all in all the biggest problem was the meandering, confusing plot. All the characters are very dislikable. You actually HOPE the child spends christmas alone because he's a nasty, annoying little psychopath.They don't introduce the characters properly or slow the action to get an emotional connection.Not even a cameo from buzz mccallister in the original movie saved it in any capacity. It just reminded us to go straight over to watch the original ... Avoid!

I don't understand why they keep trying to recreate the Home Alone movies. It's never going to happen. The first two were phenomenal and will never be matched.This one was better than the previous few, but it's still not a patch on the original two.In fact, I'd guess that if this hadn't boasted the "Home Alone" title, that it probably would've gone mostly unknown.

Imagine Home Alone where they spend all of the time in the movie setting up the burglars as good guys and then hit them with the same "theyd be dead if this wasnt cartoon logic" booby traps as the others. What a disaster! Hire better writers!

Ahead of watching this movie, I'd already heard quite a few negative reviews. I'm assuming that most folks were comparing it to the original film, but that's a bit unfair.It's in continuity with the original two films, which is a nice touch, but other than some blatent refreneces (mainly by the only returning character, (Officer) Buzz McCallister), it's actually quite original. It does have quite a few nods to the original film, but for a fan of the franchise as a whole, like myself, there are also nods to the other films as well. A trap from "Home Alone 3" here, even a slight "Home Alone 4" nod there.But back to the originality. ALL of the other five films feature bumbling, but professional thieves attempting to break into a house to steal something. That's not the case here, and it's VERY refreshing. A simple misunderstanding leads to the trap scene. That scene, as well as the rest of the film is also quite funny, which is always a win for a comedy.I admit that I went into it with low expectations, but I was pleasantly surprised and will be throwing it into the Christmas film rotation in the coming years.

My husband and I really enjoyed this movie. It was a little bit of a different storyline, which was a nice change. There was nothing spectacular about the movie, but it was a great one time Xmas watch. When watching it, don't think about part 1 and 2, and just think of this movie on its own. Not sure why there are so many bad reviews, enjoy it for what it is. Grab a hot chocolate and have fun!
All the problem begin from the kid, not like the REAL home alone movies. The kid just being annoying and stupid to innocent persons. The storyline are blur, very cringe, no logic.

reviews.review_title: The fastest way to ruin your career.
reviews.content: Everyone involved in this is likely never going to be hired again.Absolutely shocking, please... for your mental health do not watch this. Forget it's existence and move on with your life. You'll thank me :)

Worst christmas film since diehard... and in the words of Bruce Willis
..its not a Christmas movie.This film is sluggish from start to finish... poor casting... acting and budget.. it makes a mockery of the originals which are Christmas film (timeless) classics.

reviews.review_title: Max is the worst main protagonist in the home alone era
reviews.content: Max and his British mom carol are like the worst protagonist and minor antagonist. And the story lost its plot, the husband and wife only wanted to get back the doll to keep the house, but max Mercer is stupid enough to assume they are robbers. If I was him I would've asked "why are you two here?" Afterwards, they could just say what they came for then I would give them the doll. None of this extra stuff had to happen in the plot.

This film lacks the essence that made the 1990 original so iconic. For starters, the adorable little Brit from JoJo Rabbit is arguably the most annoying and least-endearing character in the entire film. At least viewers were able to connect with Kevin in the original in some form. The kid is a borderline psychopath, as most of his traps are extreme to the point of serious injury or even death. Also, the script is just lazy. There are many jokes that try to be on-the-nose with regards to "people remaking the classic, and how they aren't as good as the originals". The problem is, the script isn't clever enough to to validate this type of meta-humor. This is direct-to-dvd level quality; in this case it's direct-to-Disney +.

reviews.review_title: Solid cast, decent story, only thing missing was heart
reviews.content: Would have been better with a bit less of the McKenzie family, and a bit more time spent on Max. We didn't really get to know his character. The first half of the movie is definitely better than the second half but overall, I enjoyed it.

Heading sounds like a horror film right? Well that's what happens in this film. The problem with this is that the baddies are too nice and didn't deserve any of the Tom and Jerry esq violence inflicted on them. They were a bunch of parents financially struggling rather than the low life crooks in the earlier films that deserved it.

Despite what most of the critics said, this is a very enjoyable film. It has great physical comedy scenes in addition to some really strong acting performances. Archie Yates was supremely funny in the leading role. The mother and father were also quite effective in there own right. Overall, the movie works well as a nice little holiday comedy.

Don't even bother to watch this. I have no idea who thought this movie was a good idea. It's cheap and not acted very well. I hate how this is the same franchise that made the first 2. That's where they should have stopped.

reviews.review_title: How can you mess up even this...
reviews.content:
Imagine the original home alone classic movie but this time :
the bad guys are actually the good guys and you feel sorry for themthe kid is actually a d..k to everybody and totally unrelatable and not funny at allSomeone had to be drunk when writing this and reversed the roles but kept the main original story..Stay far away from this garbage..

Missed everything that made the original movie so great. Everything.If you're going to remake a movie and put such little effort into how's it constructed from plot to casting to writing and more; why would I choose to watch this one over the original?Just watch the first two home alone movies... next.

Gave it 10 minutes before turning it off the acting was god awful. The main kid wow that kid was awful!!!! Overall a hot mess. Even the 6 year old said it's bad and told
Me to turn it off.

What a joke, the creators of this should be ashamed... completely missed the point if the original. Some clever references to the original. But just terrible. I don't know where to begin with this... just don't watch it. Making an absolutely awful kid so glorified... what the hell were they thinking with this one.

I'm really surprised that this movie has scored so low. Myself and my family really enjoyed it. We laughed a lot. I couldn't feel the love between the mother and son, but that's the only negative thing I can say about it. Other than that I thought it was great! I'll definitely be watching this again soon!
Sorry but nothing happens for half the movie, over all waste of time even though you want to have some brainless comedy, doesn't even deliver that.you feel. Sympathy for thief actually.

reviews.review_title: Not as bad as you might assume. Worth a watch
reviews.content: The "remake".Not as bad as expected and definitely worth a watch. Its quite funny in parts with plenty of throw backs to the original.The new Kevin (called Max in this) is a bit rubbish, and for some reason British, but all round its good fun and kids will love it. Mine said it was the best one yet!! (Obviously theyre wrong though). As long as you don't keep comparing it to the first one and judge it on its own merits then you should enjoy it, its not as bad as the reviews are saying.

This movie is literally pointless violence that isn't funny and is grotesque such as the guy getting a 8 ball to the head and the women getting her feet broken, nothing is funny and everything is terrible, plus the 2 "villains" are just trying to steal there doll back, and nobody is arrested or cared about, it's like they got told what home alone was down the phone and wrote the script In 1 day, it is a awful dead rip off of home alone.

reviews.review_title: Time to damage your childhood movie !
reviews.content: So weak actors, weak screenplay, week director.This is a scene by scene copy from original home alone movie. So dont waste your time and your money for watch this poor movie.

reviews.review_title: "This is garbage I don't know why they are always trying to remake the classics"
reviews.content: The worst thing you could do going into this movie would be to watch it constantly comparing it to the Macaulay Culkin ones, you will be disappointed. In fact, you will be disappointed. Even the reimagining of the iconic theme tune will leave you disappointed.

This is NOT a bad movie. It's a very enjoyable holiday film for the family or to watch with your significant other.No it is not better than the first two movies, but it is eons better than HA3.The references back to the original are done tastefully. The cast is solid and performances are all good.Ignore these incels that give it 1 stars. It's a decent film and I'm not easily pleased.

Main actor is just awful and irritating. The story is garbage. The KID is the criminal and the "criminals" are just trying to retrieve their property that the kid stole in the first place. Best part of this movie? "Buzz" reprises his role in the series. Yep, that's it. Don't waste the hour and 33 mins of your life watching this pile of ridiculousness.

The kid perished in the garage from carbon monoxide. He was stuck in purgatory. His mother never actually left and was mentally unstable. This explains why she thought she needed to speak Japanese to an American airlines attendant. The burglars were just an excuse to explain the missing lid. If this plot sounds ridiculous then the movie will make you critically insane.

When they will stop making remakes to home alone. Because they changed name is still Home Alone but this one not worth watching.Another kid left home and another kid going to protect home and so on and on and on. The home has burglary alarm but the kid is going out and in with out any trigger of the alarm .. that's good one.

reviews.review_title: Obvious cash grab and Disney wins everytime.
reviews.content: I won't watch this. Previous to seeing the trailer, I already knew I wouldn't watch it. Aside from the first two beloved classics, I saw the 3rd and I was horrified at how bad it was. Why on Earth would I watch the 4th and 5th? Now Disney acquires 20th Century Fox and makes a 6th!!!!!! I saw the trailer and it was enough to nail that door shut in perpetuity because you know another and another will keep coming BECAUSE PEOPLE WATCH THEM!!! (Whether out of curiosity or, well, who knows). Disney gets new subscribers for it and people watch it.If you really liked it and/or the kids did, awesome, it was worth your time and expense if you subscribed for the first time. Everyone is allowed their opinion. We all have different tastes. But if you went in knowing you would hate it but curious, then don't complain it's a crime against the originals. Disney wins. Nearly 12k rated this, some were probably new. Imagine how many actually watched it and hated it??I get the service because I love the live action from the 60's and 70's, the classic Christmas and Halloween movies, Pixar and the Simpsons. I have seen the Marvel movies and the series'. I, however, will not pay the premium for some of the new movies. That's absurd. I can wait.I really hope most of the parents have introduced the originals, though. They are a treasure. My husband was at the grocery store today and I was on the phone making dinner. There was a little boy about Kevin's age who come up to the checkout behind him with a small cart. He was wearing winterwear with a pompom-topped stocking cap. He put the separation bar down and my husband looked at him and said to the checker, "Kevin McCallister". She apparently gave him a dumbfounded look. He said to me he was waiting for him to take a Stouffer's Mac and Cheese out of the cart. (Yes, the mother was there, she ran back to get something.). So sad, a young person not knowing who Kevin is.😱I digress...if you know you are going to hate it, then don't watch it and then b**** about it. Curiousity killed the cat but it doesn't kill the bottom line.

How can you ever root for an entitled spoiled brat. It makes Me root for the family who's robbing what's actually theirs in the first place.Horrible story line.. Crappy script...
Honesty I feel bad for the robbers...Disney you have got to do better...

Negative reviews for this are all based on comparisons that don't need to be made. As a stand-alone movie, it's fun and clean and great for the family. Watch it with your kids and just enjoy.Some of y'all need to take a deep breath lol.

Home alone 1 and 2 easly the best. Number 3 came along awful 4 comes out of nowhere dreadful then theirs 5 which I just didn't get.Now we have this one when I saw the trailer I had no hope for this film and to be honest I'm almost right.It's not great but it's not as bad as I thought.If anything it's okay theirs some funny gags.Some light hearted moments. But unfortunately the one that ruins the movie is the main star max. I dont blame him as much as he's only a child. Blame the director theirs just no charm and can be very annoying. Theirs nothing that stands out in this film. But I guess it's worth watching once.

I have to say they really tried. But failed miserably. The "bad guys" aren't bad guys at all and while the kids have fun with the booby traps, the parents can really empathize with the couple and few really bad for the way things are happening. And it's kinda impossible to find it funny. It could have been really really good... but it was, in my opinion another failed remake.

I'm not against remakes in most cases and was going to go into this with an open mind as some of the cast i have enjoyed but man this is just awful.The change of premise makes no sense at all and almost like they wanted to play "you know no one is the bad guy really" which is the point of the original...hero vs villains.The kid have seen in things but this he just is wooden and can not act what's so ever, I'm not sure why.This didn't need to be made and if they planned on it they should of leaned all the way in and go 100% for it but this is just making a mockery of a series that was once loved and stand the test of time.

reviews.review_title: A nostalgic glow in the shadow of giants
reviews.content: I consider Maculay Culkin one of the greatest child actors ever, and his performances in home alone 1&2 made him an international treasure. I watch both of the originals every year, and I knew that Home sweet home alone wouldn't get close to the brilliance of the OGs. That being said, it wasn't terrible.We do get to see Buzz again, and along with all the callbacks, that made it all worth it to me. The charm, humour and wit of the first movies are lacking, and I didn't laugh more than a couple of times throughout the entire movie, but the nostalgic music, traps and callbacks made me smile throughout.Give it a chance. If you love HA 1&2 I think it'll be worth your time, just don't excpect anything close to the classics.

reviews.review_title: Totally opposite plot and not a good Home Alone movie
reviews.content: This one is totally backwards and is not worth watching. Instead of the kid being the good guy defeating the bad guys, the kid is the bad guy and the people invading his house are trying to get back something he stole. Why did they even make this? This is poor and a disgrace to the Home Alone series. Leave movies alone and stop changing the plots.
Real feel good movie. Really enjoyed it and there was a good few very funny bits. My 6 and 8 year old love it. Not a remake so people need to relax and just enjoy!

I was hopeful that this movie would be something to add to the tradition of Christmas movie watching but it was a let-down. Nothing to laugh at, nothing to quote! No great characters. No great lines. No great scenes.

This was actually a great home alone movie I can't believe how a lot of people rated this poorly. I haven't seen a good movie like this in years. This movie really deserves better credit than what it got from people who rated this movie. I would like to think the directors and the people who made this movie because again it was really amazing to watch.

Yes, I saw the trailer and thought this is not good. However, sat down with the family and enjoyed it. Different premise than all the other movies with more focus on the 'intruders', where you got to know them a lot more and understand their motives. There were a few nods to the original movies. What I didn't like was all the traps, in that every single one of the those would cause major long term damage or death, though I thought the same in the original movie, but did see past that at the time. I thought this version would have a slightly different approach. Some jokes did fall flat and were not funny at all which included the plane seating scene.

reviews.review_title: There's something not quite right about this film. Hopefully it funds new self-written projects for Bea and Delaney
reviews.content: The script just doesn't feel right. The audience certainly isn't rooting for Max (the new Kevin) or his parents for most of the movie. The whole goody vs baddies dynamic is lost and the movie is the worse for it.Archie Yates lacks charisma, he's slightly wooden (his performance has "school play" vibes)... but maybe it was down to terrible direction and he's actually a future Alec Guinness...? Macaulay Culkin set the bar very high, who else is going to match that levels? Macaulay also had Chris Columbus directing and a John Hughes script - so maybe Archie is better than this performance...Ellie Kemper and Rob Delaney do all that can be done with a subpar script. I cannot say a bad thing about the fantastic Aisling Bea, she does her best too - hopefully the money from this will help fund her next self-written project.Max's Dad, Uncle and Aunt are unmemorable and insipid.The score is boosted to 4/10 because of a special guest appearance :) Although we could have seen more of that guest!Oh well... I'm sure they'll try another remake!

reviews.review_title: Not as bad as the ratings make it look...
reviews.content: It's a decent movie. It is what it is supposed to be. Don't expect it to be anything amazing, it's a fun, quick Christmas movie. It won't be a classic but it's fine for a one-time watch with the kids.
This is absolutely the worst movie I have seen!!! Garbage 🗑 🚮 🗑 🚮 Please don't even bother to watch it. It's not worth the watch!!! Trust me and all the other reviews!!!!

This is not a remake, in fact with the inclusion of Buzz McAlister and references to Kevin and the first two movies it's very solidly a separate story in the same universe. Your kids will love it, mine did. If you love Hallmark movies, the acting in this will blow your mind and you'll probably think this should win best picture in comparison. For everyone else, it's just ok. The kid is a jerk, there are no actual villains, and the adults are all idiots. But, it is mildly entertaining, once.
You thought Home Alone 3 was bad? Well wait till you watch this one (but don't watch it if you want my advice that is).My eyes were hurting. How did they allow this movie to be made???!!!

reviews.review_title: It's horrible,even for a movie that tries to make you laugh
reviews.content: It's horrible,even just a movie and not the sequel of Home alone with plot errors. It's a stupid movie that who thinks you're stupid. It doesn't make me laugh but makes me angry.

reviews.review_title: Not as bad if you don't compare it to the original one.
reviews.content: If we stop comparing the movie to the first two movies, it's not that bad as the ratings suggest. It's a good movie and kids of today will definitely like it. All the references of original home alone movie were nice.

reviews.review_title: It was a great watch and the gags had me rolling with laughter.
reviews.content: Well, I'll preface it with, don't go in for the movie with expectations of a home alone franchise. Based on it's own merit the movie delivers really well. The 90 minutes went by quickly. I was laughing really hard in the final assault at the house. Ellie Kemper and Harry Potter ;) acted quite really well.This won't become a Christmas tradition movie but as a one time watch, it's great fun!

I am not sure what the movie is really about and if it really should even be called Home Alone as it just goes in circles. The story is weak and the acting is atrocious and to be really blunt it should be deleted from whatever movie catalogue it resides in.

reviews.review_title: A remarkable holiday special for Disney and 20th century studios
reviews.content: This movie really made me laugh and the original will always be my favorite childhood movie thanks to Chris Columbus and John Hughes for making Christmas movies for kids who may be left home alone. 20th century studios did a fantastic job adding this to Disney plus for use 90s kids .

Within the 1st five minutes you want the kid to get it. As it goes on you want the "villains" to win. This is an awful film, horrible little kid who no one is rooting for. Does this contain spoliers? No the whole film will spoil your night.

reviews.review_title: Stop messing with the classics Hollywood! Please!
reviews.content: My 5 year old said it was boring, my older son who had seen the original, kept asking why do they mess with classics. It's funny in places, you gotta give it that, but I'm Irish, and Ashling Bea is a comedy legend and a very good actress but why oh why is she doing an English accent in this.Please please please Hollywood, stop messing with the classics.

There has been so many hone alone movies and the first and second one are the only ones that are good. There's only a certain amount of ways to I guess break into someone's house. We don't need this many movies, stop wasting money on making shitty movies. The original Kevin McAllister made the movie way better,this new one just makes it seem like you are getting beat up by a rich kid who wants to watch cartoons in his parents bmw.

First half was good coz the other character except for the boy did great. After the two characters enter the home, it gets so annoying. The boy's role is very rude and unpleasant to watch and no comedy at all.

reviews.review_title: Rich Kid Ruins a Poor Families Life
reviews.content: This movie is quite possibly one of, if not THE, most out of touch, rich child fantasies I have ever had the misfortune of laying my eyes upon.The kid steal from kids in need, essentially complains about having money, and then, after using this family's house as a public toilet, steals their only way to save their house via a rare doll. They go to his house to get the doll back and, instead of asking them why they're there, he resorts to using a violent fantasy to virtually kill them.The kid goes so far as to give the mother third degree burns on her feet, forcing her to then walk on legos, and then shooting her with tacked darts, leaving small stab wounds along her body.If I could give this movie 0 stars, I would. It is nothing more than Mikey Day's rich kid fantasy of violently hurting poor people. If anything, this should make us concerned about his mental well-being. The traps in this movie are not fun as in the 1990 film, but rather grotesque and borderline torturous upon a family that has had something valuable stolen from them by a rich prick, with serial killer tendencies, and just want it back. Making a movie that centers around violently maiming, and making fun of, a poor family in 2021 when over 40% of Americans live under the poverty line is absolutely revolting. Mikey Day should never be allowed to create another movie.

If you don't compare it's a decent movie to watch with your family. Yes the original is the best and we grew up watching that but appreciate this film to recall those memoriesSo stop comparing and happy Christmas 2021.

reviews.review_title: Fun for fans of the original 2
reviews.content: I went into this not expecting much. I was pleasantly surprised. Loved the music. This was by no means catching the lightning in the bottle as Chris Columbus put it, but it was a fun blast to the past. Was awesome seeing Buzz Mccallister in this film. Some very funny antics in this movie. What would made this movie better is if Daniel Stern, Joe Pesci and Macaulay Culkin could have been in this film. That would have brought the stars up for this movie. I've always thought to do a Home Alone sequel justice, why not do one that Kevin Mccallister accidentally leaves his kid at home and the sticky bandits fresh out of prison show up to the house it all started now owned by Kevin. This time getting punishment dished out by Kevin's son. Like father like son. Back to this film, I as a mega fan of the original two movies, found this to be a fun watch and enjoyed the nostalgia that was in it.
Is it a remake of Home Alone or a new version of SAW? If We speak about the traps that this kid did. Unbelievable! I'm sorry about Archie Yates, He is a talented young boy.

reviews.review_title: This movie was hard to watch
reviews.content: When watching the movie I just felt bad because the burglars are a poor middle class family trying to save their house while some rich bully kid is beating on them for the reason he is "scared" the reason this movie is one of the worst in the franchise is because of the fact they made the movie the other way around, I know it is hard to met the standards the first movie did but the writers could have at least made the other family mean, selfish, and bad people but yet they made them sweet and lovable. They had given them a struggle to deal with and a problem to solve and I probaly would give this movie a better rating if we explored the middle class families side and not the annoying spoiled brat.

An awful child steals a doll and then tortures the people who are the rightful owners. The owners do deserve the punishment since they have chosen the worst way to get the doll back but it's still sad to see a home alone film with no heart. I don't know if I have ever seen a movie where every character is deplorable. There's no good guys or even decent people in this film. There is a family that is apparently related despite them all being of different races and nationalities, though.

This was completely unnecessary to make, not sure my kids laugh at all, and they LOVED to Original 2. God awful acting, cast was borning, however it was nice they connected it to the OG Home Alone with Buzz being in it. 1 Star for Buzz the Cop.

What's kinda of sad is that they actually got some good comedic actors to be in this movie, but the direction of story and characters did not land well. The jokes don't work and the Home Alone story is just gonna keep repeating it's self in every sequal.I do hope actors, even the main child will get to be on a better movie, Heck even a good disney movie.

The kid literally committed a felony in the first 2 minutes of the film. The rest of the film is about a struggling couple just trying to get their heirloom worth 6-figures back. I mean seriously dude, stop eating so much candy and get a life.
It's a cute little movie that turns the Home Alone idea on its head and makes the thieves more sympathetic than the kid. They're didn't pull it off 100%, but it was still enjoyable.

This movie is absolutely stupid. The plot is absurd. Not to mention the implication that boys dressing like girls is ok. About the only thing they did well was the music from the original movie. It was nice to see Buzz, but it would've been nice to see some other original cast members.
This movie actually has its funny moments. I consider this movie to be a direct sequel from Home Alone 2 Lost In New York. Not sure why so many bad reviews. Watch it and decide for yourself.
I think this version is hilarious. It starts off slow but the pranks are really funny. Over all its cute. But not as good as the first 2 originals but better than the rest of them.

reviews.review_title: A nice twist of mixing the old with the new.
reviews.content: Is this movie as good as the 1990s film...no. But this movie does give a nice little backstory of the Mccallister family, with Buzz. It also throws a nice little twist in the "good guy" & " bad guy" situation, which hasn't been done in the previous films. Is it an ultimate classic, no...but we enjoyed this movie a lot. I would put this Home Alone about several of the others.

reviews.review_title: Home Sweet Home Alone is to the original Home alone...
reviews.content: Like Scary Movie is to Scream. Unfunny. For the first bit, you are made to believe that the kid is the criminal. An interesting take, but badly delivered and overall unsatisfactory.

Dear Disney, not everything needs an update every 30ish yrs. Pls get some orginal content.In fairness I tryed to keep an open mind about this movie since i was 7ish when the original came out and basically grew up with it. However this movie, as i feared, is aweful. Or as my husband said " Garbage. Major garbage". We truned this off 45 minutes ( we only lasted that long cuse of our 9 yr old but eventully we pulled the plug). If your looking for the magic of the first one you wont find in this remake that did not need to be made.

Before I watched Home Sweet Home Alone, I thought that its plot will be exactly like any previous movie in the series, which is that a bunch of thieves try to steal or get something from a house, and the kid in that house has to stop them from doing this whatever it costs. At the end, the thieves are cought by the police, end of story. But when I watched this movie, I got so surprised and stunned because this wasn't the case.From my own point of view, Home Sweet Home Alone is the best, or one of the best, movie in the Home Alone series. It is even better than the first installment when it comes to some sides. For example, this movie introduces us to the thieves characters more closely and lets us know more about the details of their lives and why they are going to invade Max's (the main kid character) house. Not only this, but also, it makes us sympathize with them even more than Max in some situations.Also, one of the good sides of Home Sweet Home Alone is that the relationship between Max, Jeff, and Pam was not just a relationship of a kid who just wanted to stop two thieves from invading his house. There was a lot more than that because in the movie, we can see how they get to know each other more, what each person wants and how each person thinks about the other.But for me, the best part of Home Sweet Home Alone was the ending. Instead of giving us the traditional happy ending in which the thieves are defeated, the police arrive, and the thieves are cought by the police, they give us a "happier ending" in which Max knows that Jeff and Pam are not invading his house to kidnap and sell him. They are doing this only to retrieve the doll whom they think that he stole from them, and they become friends after clearing up the misunderstanding and knowing that he is home alone and currently has no one to be with on Christmas Eve, especially when discovering that he didn't even steal the doll from them. It was in their house after all. What I mean by this is that the theme of the police arresting the thieves at the end was abandoned in this movie. They wanted to bring a new idea. If it came only to the ending, I would give the movie 10 out of 10.There are also some other positive sides in Home Sweet Home Alone like the clever booby traps, the performances of Delaney and Kemper, and igniting the Home Alone franchise nostalgia once again.When it comes to the flaws, at least from my own point of view, this movie has two flaws. It would have been better if the doll was replaced by something which is "really priceless, too much expensive, and of a high value". Also, I saw that the rest of the cast performances other than Delaney's and Kemper's are very very normal. They have nothing special in them.When it comes to the score, I gladly give Home Sweet Home Alone 8 out of 10.

Pretty sure the writers forgot that the reason we liked the first one is because it was two cartoonishly evil burglars getting their comeuppance and not two working class people getting horribly maimed by some rich brat.

Ok, I find this movie extremely awful too.About a quarter into this movie, I realized the intended audience is not adults, but kids, because though the mistakes and plot holes are obvious to adults, they are non-existent to my nephew, who watched the movie with me and found it hilarious to the point i began to question if we were watching the same movie and actually sat in different dimensions next to each other.For exmaple, the VR scene.Omg it's awful, and I speak this as a hardcore gamer who happens to own a 3080 and VR headset.My nephew on the other hand, totally believed the scene and laughed hard.So if u have a kid, don't let the low score fool you, ok it's not fooling u, it's a bad movie for you and me and literally everyone on IMDB, but for kids, this can be a fantastic movie.One caution though - if you do own a VR set, ur kid will ask u non-stop afterward to play it, and no matter how hard u explain it doesnt work like in the movie, he just doesnt care and would ask again to play it.

I didn't have any hope for this movie but my husband put it on. It was better than expected and we enjoyed it. My son loves it and is now had it on repeat cor the last few days. So. We don't enjoy it as much anymore lol.

This word kept coming into my head the whole way through. I knew it wouldn't be as good as the original 2 but this was an atrocity. Unlikeable characters, ridiculous story. I'm not saying it has to be believable but it's utter dross.

Hands down the worst movie I have ever watched.....
Do not waste your time watching this as you will be wishing you could get that hour and a half of your life back.Its more entertaining painting a wall and watching it dry than watching this film.Come on Disney...this is an all time lowIf there was an option for a negative review it would have got one.If i got a pound for every time a joke landed i would not even be able to afford a cup of coffee.Main actor is unlikable and British.

reviews.review_title: Garbage. One of the worst movies ever!
reviews.content: Awful plot, zero heart and chemistry. Not funny at all even for a kids movie. The fat lead kid who looks like a miniature Hannah gadsby is so unlikable I wanted to punt him back to England with morons Harry and Meghan. Disney can't resist pushing woke narratives on kids as well, as of course they have the boy dress up in dress during a montage and focus of the doll being called ugly. God forbid the kid just be a normal smarty boy. This bologna needs to stop. Glad I didn't pay watch this trash. I got an idea disney/hollyweird, write an original story. Clowns.

Watched this with my nieces. How do you make a kids movie where you like the adult villains more then the kid protagonist. Nostalgia jokes were throughout the movie, the kid is a jerk within the first few minutes I just kept thinking he is a super brat. The booby traps are creative and a little deadly. Nice attempt but movies like this should have clear cut protagonists and antagonists.

reviews.review_title: Good gods above it is AWFUL. SPOILERS all over.
reviews.content: FIRST. IMDB you must come up with NEGATIVE ratings. I and others are serious. Second you have to ban obviously paid studio shills trying to pretend this is a great film and raise the ratings.I decided to start this review 20 minutes into the "move" and I use the term loosely as it should be called an ugly disaster and huge waste of film stock. HOW did it get a rating as high as 3.5Whoever the writers were obviously wanted to be blacklisted from Hollywood or why else would they have written something this god awful.The director as well was obviously not on set and directed this from home using ZOOM. It was written he was in negotiations to direct the movie. I'd be negotiating one thing: KEEP MY NAME OFF OF IT AND I GET TWICE MY USUAL FEE.Every single person in this so far is incredibly unlikeable and the characters. All of them come across as having a COMBINED IQ or 23.The English mom and chubbo English brat, er I mean yung kid start arguing in a strangers house and you know the kid is a thief. AND this English kid is so freaking horrible and unlikeable I am rooting for whoever takes has his pranks backfire IN THE MOVIE and sends him to the hospital where they declare this franchise DOA.He is NOT funny, he is a rude little creep and the family should have sold him. I detest him beyond belief and has anyone EVER met a ten year old who talks like this?FURTHER...Hollywood STOP making every kid in movies rude, sullen and stop making them running amok funning into adults and pushing them out of the way, throwing things at the adults and each other, yelling and screaming. I have NEVER seen this and as a military brat and later family man we saw a lot of parties, large families. Once upon a time children were portrayed realistically. Not anyore.STOP making kids like this. I know it is SUPPOSED to be a comedy but all it does is make the adults and most kids think WHY are they raised to be total little monsters in every movie.FURTHER stop making the dads so freaking stupid.AND this little bit really ticked me off. WHY is the family afraid to tell their own children they are selling the house and why? WHEN did kids run households in movies.Further when the kids ask who the real estate agent is, IF they wanted to make up a story WHERE THE HELL DID THEY COME UP WITH HE IS DAD'S PERSONAL TRAINER. How about just saying he is a new fried of the dads????The kids would not care at all. They would be introduced and both would say nice to meet you and the kids would be off.Besides my son, I also raised my two nieces and we moved three times to better homes for my extended family over the years and not ONCE did the girls or my son throw temper tantrums to make the family afraid. Moving is a part of life for most Americans and every kid I've known besides my three charges, first thing was 'Where we moving to" When we moving and it became and adventure.This movie is a prime example of making those two points WORSE THAN EVER. Why does Hollywood INSIST on doing this. Just like they make ever man in the movies and TV have a permanent 4 day beard growth and they ALL look alike now I always thought it made them look like bums who needed to wash their faces. BUT I DIGRESS.The plotline is a weak as anything Hollywood has ever come up with. It makes PLAN 9 FROM OUTER SPACE look like Star Wars.The plot is beyond stupid. Seriously. The first family selling the home, think the obnoxious little English brat stole a valuable doll and head over to where the brat lives. They see the family all getting ready to leave.AND INSTEAD OF JUST WALKING UP AND SAYING "We think your kid may have taken one of our antique dolls and would like to get it back". AS ANY ADULT WOULD DO...except in lame Disney movies.NO they plot to break in and steal it back and as a result the English brat pulls all the usual BUT idiotically different stunts as the original movie to thwart the "robbers"BUT like all Disney movies the whole thing is cleared up and everyone hugs and kisses and they all have holidays together and like all Disney movies dad gets a new job with AND God I just cannot go on.All I can say is.AVOID THIS MOVIE LIKE YOU WOULD COVID 19.

Even though like most I couldn't understand why they were remaking such a classic movie. I did have high hopes for some of the cast, mainly Rob Delaney, Aisling Bea and Ellie Kemper who have been excellent in other productions.Sadly this movie was so badly written and directed I had trouble watching it all the way through. Although the main part was well acted by Archie Yates, he had nowhere near the charm as the original, and was in some parts just unlikeable (obviously not his fault, no one could top Macauley anyway).If just a tiny bit of though had been put into the script or story this could have bee heaps better. Also changing Harry and Marv from ruthless crooks to a couple (albeit cartoonish and stupid) just down on their luck, was the worst part of the movie for mePlease Disney stop doing these obvious cash grabs, just because you can, doesn't mean you should.
It's basically the rich kid vs struggling parents trying to do right during Christmas time. Rich vs poor is not a good look for Disney at this time (or anytime).Would not watch it ever again.

I love this movie! I learned how to adjusting the present instead dwelling in the past. I learned something that there is no remake. Just history repeating but this time the battle plan and break in was all misunderstanding which make it funnier! I like this one better than the original.

Is this movie perfect? No. Is it on par with the original? No. But does it have charm and things to commend? Yes, I say so. While "Home Sweet Home Alone" does follow in the same footsteps of the originals in places, it does offer some new ideas to the story that I can respect. You can feel why Max wants to be left alone, and he's not a brat about it like Kevin in the original. The burglars have a good reason and story for why they want to break into his house, the end has a clever twist and expectation subversion that I fully respect. And the end was really sweet and heartwarming.Add in some nods to the originals and other movies and you have a solidly fine yet familiar "Home Alone".

Not funny at all. The main child is awful. Greedy selfish and fat. Worst Christmas film I have ever seen. Doesn't have the same effect as the first films, instead of hating the burglars, you hate the kid.

reviews.review_title: Ellie Kemper and Rob Delaney were hysterical
reviews.content: The movie was funny. It would have been better not as a Home Alone movie though. The kid was the true villain in this one. The movie would have worked better if it just focused on Ellie Kemper and Rob Delaney. Worth a watch.

Like the title says I'm barely halfway through the movie but I dislike the kid so much I'm writing my review early. Whoever approved this script needs to be so fired. The "main" kid is a horrible brat, who talks back to his mom for no reason, and hates his family for being annoying. Unlike the original home alone, his family doesn't bully him, there's like one scene where he's written off because of all the chaos and any sympathy you feel for him is gone when he bothers his mom on the phone with the airlines. Any part I laughed at was more because of cringe and not because the joke was actually funny. Also there's at least two scenes of an actors face full on showing you the mashed up food in their mouth, it's weird. Anyways the kid is the real villain, the "heroes" are just an idiot couple. Idiot couples can be super funny, not these two. I despise this movie with my entire being. We all knew it was a cash grab Disney, it didn't have to be the worst cash grab on the planet.

reviews.review_title: Trailer pretty much showed it all
reviews.content: They should add laugh tracks so people can tell when they're supposed to laugh. Idk who this movie is geared towards, but this movie definitely isn't a family movie. Crazy how with all the new technologies and innovations in the film industry, people still somehow deliver worse sequels.

reviews.review_title: Easily the third best home alone
reviews.content: While this film is a far cry from either of the original films it blows any of the other pathetic attempts at a home alone without Macaulay Culkin out of the water. They definitely attempt a few too many nods to the original but the kid has a unique personality, the new take on the motivation of the bad guys breaking in is refreshing and the way they got around the plot still working even with cell phones and all the other 21st century technology was well done. Not the greatest but a solid enough film to try.

I came into this movie with extremely low expectations, and it actually wasn't quite as bad as I thought it might be, but it was still pretty bad.The movie attempts to stir up the basic Home Alone formula by focusing most of the movie on the Burglars, who in this case are just a down on their luck Suburban Couple who are under the impression that the Kid stole a valuable doll from their house. The problem with this approach, is that it makes the viewer way more sympathetic to these characters, who aren't Eagle Scouts, but lack any actual malice. So it's not fun to watch them get hurt by the traps, it's just sad.Another problem is that this leaves Max very under-developed and much less the sympathetic underdog that Kevin was. The actor is clearly older, and never really seems scared or worried about his predicament. His Family is also very under-developed. If you blink you'll miss his Dad, it's not clear who everyone in the Family even is. You never see a Cousin or Sibling ever being mean to him or worry about him being home alone. Basically, Max has a little fun in the house, then gets bored, and starts to miss his family a bit. This is like 10 minutes tops of screen time.So, despite some attempts to shake things up, the only thing this changes from the original is that it makes the Kid less likable and the Burglars more sympathetic, so it's not clear who we're even supposed to be rooting for.The film did have some funny moments, and I thought the cast did the best they could. But I would skip this one.

Listen to me. If you have seen (by accident) part 4 and 5, also 3. Give a chance and watch this. It is way better.Had some good laughs. Truly we had. I liked the little nods to the original 2 parts of Home alone (also that the original will always be better than the remakes). Had a surprise guest from the movies 1 and 2. A bit more original idea than just a robbers coming to a home. I liked the misunderstanding and the ending of the movie. This will never be as good as the original Home Alone but it was simple and funny. Worth it especially when we watched part 4 right before this (wasted time).

As others have pointed out, there's really no bad guys in this film which makes for a complete lack of humor when the good guys just trying to save their family get beaten and bruised by hellish traps.Whoever thought it was fine to change the plotline from "Kid defends himself from Wet Bandits" to "kid nearly murders caring couple over misunderstanding" doesn't understand the original or why it was so good. This one hurt to watch.
Not bad for a kids movie, but very unrealistic and dumb. Acting is what you would expect for a poor quality plot. Contains some funny parts but it tries too hard to be like the original.

All of the Home Alone sequels after 2 have been pointless. This is the first sequel to try to do something interesting. While not a great movie there is an honest attempt here. This movie is aimed at kids who liked the first movie. Adult fans of the first movie will not "rediscover the magic" though, but they may enjoy watching it with their 8-11 year old kids.Definitely worth watching if you have access to the streaming service already, but not worth going out of your way to see.

Honestly, this is disgraceful. Why was this even made? Archie Yates? Shocking. At this point it's just disappointing that people take a classic and ruin it with poor 'up to date' sequels/versions of the film.

reviews.review_title: Sometimes you gotta leave a franchise alone
reviews.content: This is a classic example where the studio execs can't fathom leaving Home Alone alone. The direction is flimsy, the acting sub par and there's no originality or thought put into the screenplay. Maybe your 5 year old nephew may get a kick out of this, otherwise it's not worth wasting time over.

reviews.review_title: Why did they even think to make it?
reviews.content: Home alone 1 and 2 are classic and one of the best movies I have ever seen on the other hand even though a huge change of everything home alone 3 was not bad it was average to ok movie but home alone 4 seriously most of the people don't even know whether that exists and home alone 5 not worse than 4 but also bad. They tried to add horror but failed miserably so when u can see that the franchise is getting so many negative reactions from public why make another one BUT NO NO NO we got home sweet home alone although i won't say this is bad as part 4 and 5 but it's also NOT GOOD idk why but i think a lot of the actors did overacting but i actually like the acting of the thieves but i won't call them thieves because there is not thief in this movie it's all about a freaking doll which was with; ok i won't give spoilers. I don't hate the idea of bringing buzz from home alone 1 and 2 but I thought that McCallister badge would be of Kevin so just because of the 2 thieves and that buzz McCallister i will give this movie a 1.5 ✨ out of 5 and 3 out of 10 but please stop releasing more of home alone remakes anyways my Christmas is ruined so don't ruin yours goodbye.

Of course we weren't expecting it to be as good as the first two, but come on put some effort into the film instead of just riding the name. I regularly watch the series with my kids and couldn't get past half way on this one.

Why reshoot movies or cartoons that already have a high rating, a lot of fans. As a rule, these are always unsuccessful options. Alone at home with Macaulay is a film of Christmas, New Year, pleasant memories. The new version of the film is a reminder that the current cinema has outlived itself.

I think this is one of my least favorite Holiday movies. The slap stick got to the point of being way to much especially for a kids movie. Misunderstanding humor is no longer funny. Oh ha ha their not really criminals so I almost killed them for no reason oh ha ha. I hates this Disney y'all gone too far messing with one of my favorite classic Christmas Movies. Goodbye to happy holiday memories.

reviews.review_title: This film has no charm whatsoever.
reviews.content: This film has no charm whatsoever.Grown up jokes about "the Cloud" soon run dryThe over-acting is rather freaky (and shrieky!!) at timesAnd I doubt most child viewers will relate to a kid who dresses, talks, and acts like an adultWhere has the magic and light-heartedness gone, Disney?
Ignore the crybabies this isn't a remake of home alone 1 & 2. They were creative with the story and it was entertaining and funny. It was a good family film. Watch it.

reviews.review_title: Ignore the reviews - it's actually better than the original in a lot of ways
reviews.content: I was expecting this to be absolutely terrible but it's actually really good. There's some quality actors including a few from Saturday Night Live, and the script is surprisingly clever.The premise is not the same as the original and some parts were even funnier than the original. Definitely recommend it.

reviews.review_title: Entertaining refresh that suffers from a multitude of issues
reviews.content: Okay so I'll start with the positives. This film decides to focus on the robbers and make them the good guys. This film's version of Kevin (I think his name was Max) allegedly stole something from the robbers and they just wanted to take it back. Unfortunately, the kid thinks they are breaking in to kidnap him and sets up traps. This focus on multiple sides to the same story by showing different perspectives is an interesting new concept for Home Alone films. I also love all the callbacks and references. For example, the alarm code is 1112 and a character makes a joke that that is her anniversary. This film is a Disney+ original and Disney+ launched on November 12. Also a sign outside their house indicates "Protected by McCallister Home Security" and a grown up Buzz (Officer McCallister) is a police officer who directly mentions Kevin and his security company by name.Alright now let's get the issues. The dialogue sucks. The writers were trying to be relatable, funny, and relevant so lines are all slang, Illtimed jokes, or adults trying to be cool. It really comes off as cringe and shows how out of touch big studios can be. Also every freaking character is a blabbering idiot. Cartoon slapstick violence is to be expected during the break in, but the entire film characters are slipping, letting their pants fall down, etc. Characters fall for the dumbest things. Because of the writing teams decision to mix it up and make the robbers the good guys, the traps aren't funny. You don't like watching the robbers get hurt. And to make the robbers look justified, they make the kid a spoiled brat.It doesn't have any of the heart of the original nor the genius storytelling. However I do like the departure from the formula and it was a solid way to spend two hours.

reviews.review_title: Home Not So Sweet Home Alone (haha punny)
reviews.content: As someone who grew up on the original Home Alone movies, even watching the third, fourth and remembering snippets of the fifth movie, I found that the series only survived off of McCulkin's acting and his charisma as a child actor.I do think the cinematography and acting in this one is better than the last few renditions, I feel that the lazy script, rushed pacing, nonsensical character actions and overall forced conflict is what drags down this movie for me.The actors did the best they could with their roles and the kid who plays Max is a good kid actor, but his character was so awful to almost everyone around him and he was simply a spoiled brat. He whines and complains about everything, gets mad when his mom won't humor him when she's on a phone call, he mocks the husband, one of the thieves in this movie, for having dolls but is okay wearing his mom's clothes, which seemed very off to me and he was going to take toys meant for less privileged children for himself, and even tricked an old woman with his fake sob story. I'm sorry but how am I supposed to like him? Not to mention he gets less screen time than the antagonists of this movie and that worked against him as well.He's simply an annoying brat who pouts when he doesn't get his way and he seems to have a normal family unlike Kevin's who's family were jerks to him even when he was just ten. You can say I'm romanticizing the old movies, but in those you actively rooted for Kevin to beat Harry and Marv and his family didn't do much to really show them in a good light. Meanwhile Max is shown to have decent parents, well his mom at the very least, and he doesn't have it all that bad either, so beats me as to why he's so mopey all the time.The couple, Pam and Jeff, ironically enough were the most likable in the film, and that really gave the movie a really confusing and borderline toxic message. By making us sympathize with the two who are looking to sell their house, since Jeff is losing his job, you inadvertently make them less of a threat that the Wet Bandits were in the original movies. That being said, these two are likable, but they make the dumbest leaps in logic I've ever seen in a film. This movie didn't need to happen, all Pam and Jeff had to do were to ring the doorbell and ask Max if he had the doll they were looking for, as simple as that.They could have even waited until the family came back to ask, but their logic is so messed up that it makes no sense. They act so incredulous and make the stupidest mistakes that you wonder if them getting hurt by all the traps makes you feel bad or want to see them get hurt for all their idiocy. When I say the conflict is contrived, this is what I mean. Pam seemed to have the most smarts to her, but she loses all her brain cells when they actually get to the house, Jeff flubs up the most, but these two are concerned about going to jail, but say screw logic and break and enter into someone's home anyway because they need that doll dang it.What really bothers me about these two is that they get off way too easy for a simple misunderstanding that they could have avoided if they simply acted like rational adults and waited for the family to come back or even asked Max if he had it by walking up to the door and ringing the bell. It's like the script forced them to avoid taking the logical route for this convoluted series of shenanigans to happen. You mean to tell me that these two have a family to care for, but are willing to risk jail time for this doll they have no idea if this kid even stole, unbelievable, especially when it's revealed that their nephew took the doll, so their efforts were in vain.No amount of references is gonna save this film either, just because you put a grown up Buzz in the movie doesn't make it any better. He ended up serving no purpose in the film other than to give a cheesy call back and since the couple don't really face any major consequences aside from footing the bill to help fix the house, his presence as a cop is null and void.Imagine if Harry and Marv got off all because they didn't want to kill Kevin, but wanted him to be safe or escort him to his family and meant well, it'd ruin the charm.The traps were in the home alone vein and I liked them a lot, they were very creative and the one liners from the kid and the couple were funny. I do think all this trap making was once again, all in vain because the couple and Max could have simply talked and avoided this altercation altogether. Kevin knew that there was no compromising with the thieves since they'd double cross him, but in this movie's case, Pam and Jeff were made sympathetic which just makes Max look like even more of a sociopath than Kevin. Max may have been a brat, but he's no way unreasonable, so the traps which are the hallmark of these movies are made gratuitous when all of this stemmed from a silly misunderstanding that could have been resolved had the couple acted like adults.I'm rambling but yeah, this movie deserved the bad reviews it got from everyone, to the ones who gave it good reviews, good for you I guess? I just didn't like it, and no cheeky comments about remakes and reboots being trash is gonna make it any better, its lame.
The acting is bad. Every single one of them. The story is completely copy and paste. This is fitting for 2021 a dumpster fire that would be best left as a memory rather than an experience.

The acting was actually decent and not some cheesy b movie acting level. The amount of well known actors/actresses that know how to act also helped carry the film. Having buzz in it is a great throwback. It's an interesting twist having both the robbers and the kid ultimately be likeable, relatable, and redeeming characters. My whole family enjoyed it, I've watched it many times and would recommend it to anyone who isn't a grinchy miserable scrooge.

I don't understand why movie companies just won't let a franchise die, because there's now SIX movies...The first two Home Alone movies are obviously the best, Lost in New York being a great sequel. But after that it started to crash and burn because there were movie sequels made for some reason.BUT this is honestly the worst Home Alone movie ever released and lemme tell you about it so I couldn't even get passed thirty minutes of this.So the McKenzie's are having an open house and this kid steals a valuable doll from them, after they find out they go to BREAK into the kid's home to get it back. The kid thinks they're trying to KIDNAP him so then he sets up traps along the house.This plot makes ZERO sense, not only is it ridiculous but it's taxing on the viewer's sense of comprehension. Yes, I'm calling a family movie out for being unrealistic. First of all, the kid KNEW he was stealing so he probably should've checked that out.
