And the burglars are actually a couple trying to get their damn doll back, couldn't have they just, you know...ASK?! I thought the point of the movie series is that they're tryna rob someone's house then they get a whoopin'. Not where they're breaking in to get someone back.Funny how the tagline is "Holiday Classics were meant to be broken", because that perfectly describes this film....
The plot made no sense. Every bit of the plot was unjustified. And the ending made no sense. This movie could not even hold the attention of my 5 and 7 years olds.

It doesn't even come close to comparing to the original Home Alone. My almost 8 year loved the original. He said half way through this one he was done watching it because it was terrible. I completely agree. Not funny. The kid isn't that great of an actor in this movie. The tricks played on the man and woman wasn't good. Terrible acting!

What the world has become 1991 vs 2021... I am sure it's much more "correct" than the original, but there is no such thing as "correct" comedy. Maybe they should have named the kid Brandon, we would be cheering for him!

I seriously don't get how someone could've seen Home Alone, then make a movie that quite literally has almost nothing in common with it. Whoever wrote the screenplay for this movie failed on such an astronomical level that they genuinely should look for another career outside of the film industry. I've never seen such a nonsensical story paired with even worse dialogue. Literally nothing about this movie makes any sense and it's not entertaining. Your time would be better spent staring at a wall than watching this film, I guarantee you.

reviews.review_title: Another example of how cheap and lazy Hollywood is getting.
reviews.content: Literally a more modern copycat of the 1st Home Alone. This film has you rooting for the pathetic "villians" versus the brat kid who's the main character.
Wow , I didn't see such a bad movie with such bad actors in a long time. Boring , the story is scrambled , terrible in all way possible. Just waste of time.

What the hell is even this movie, I didn't expect much but wow. They're trying soo hard to be funny, and just missed out every point on home alone movies. You guys need to not even fired the writer, you need to sue them for making this way worse than I expected.

reviews.review_title: Comparison is the thief of joy.
reviews.content: We watch Home Alone 1 and 2 in the mini van year round. On repeat. They are our favorite movies, and nothing will ever compare to the originals. We tuned into this one because we are Disney+ subscribers, and it was included. And why not give it a watch!? It was something new to watch, with some of our favorite actors. And we liked it a lot! We laughed. We snuggled with our kids. I really wish people would be a little kinder with their opinions... especially around the holidays. To those involved in the making of this fun, cute movie, I say... thank you!! Happy season!

It's definitely better than 3 not bad, 4 is a disaster & 5 is one we've watched every Christmas since it came out but falls just short of 1 & 2 which is not surprising.Considering we watch jingle all the way which is considered a flop by some but is firmly established as a Christmas favourite with our family which some people will disagree with.It's Christmas it's time for over the top kids films and this does it.This 6th instalment has been watched several times already by our family and enjoyed each time.Loved watching Rob in this part who we've watched since catastrophe.All the other actors and actresses were good to.We really enjoyed this film and will be watching it for years to come at Christmas time.

How can they even put Home Alone and this is the same planet!I don't know where to start.Poor title, even worse acting. If you can call it acting. They felt like they were all in pain reading of cue cards. Not sure if it was the actors or the script.Just couldn't do it at all.Turned it off, no McDonald's for any of them I say!

Some funny moments. Overall painful to watch. The premise is the same...old...thing.If the "intruders" were actually criminals it would have more palatable, but these were everyday people actually on hard times and the boy stole from them. They were just trying to get it back. Yes, they went about it wrong but...Not a fan.
In stead of Kevin what did you do to my room, Disney what did you do to this movie.. Cheap knock of. Disgraceful reuse of the classic music in this zero feeling Christmas Movie.

If it was possible to give this movie less than 1 stars, I would! Disney has outdone itself in the horrible and unnecessary remake department with this horrendous film. Everything that makes the original Home Alone such a beloved classic is ruined here. The entire concept is flipped on its head to the point where you wish the "robbers" would succeed in unaliving Not Kevin. Speaking of which - the actor who plays Not Kevin was adorable in Jojo Rabbit - how could they have made him so vile in this movie?!I can't even talk about this anymore, don't want to give Disney more attention because that's just what they want.
This was the worst Movie I have ever seen on my life. It was actually funny. These actors are so talented and their talent was wasted on this movie. I would be embarrassed.

A new telling of a classic. Great, funny cast, nice homage to the original but still a fun new Christmas movie on its own. The home alone kid is super cute, too. We really enjoyed this, kids and grownups!

The premise of this movie is disturbing. A wealthy indulged kid steals a valuable heirloom from a family about to lose their home. Add terrible jokes that don't land, mediocre acting, and you have this terrible cash grab of a movie.

This movie was so awfully bad. It was terrible. That kid was a terrible actor. I'll go watch Clifford instead! Poorly written. Sad to see Buzz chime in because he probably needs money and hasn't had any films since home alone. Just piss poor all around. I mean I can't believe the writers had the courage to remake this film. Do not waste your time watching it. They need to take it off Disney Plus.

reviews.review_title: Leave your brain at the door and just enjoy!
reviews.content: So is this the best Christmas movie ever, a worth remake of the original, finally the one that we can say "wow that was so much better than the original!"... Heck No, but why worry.It's a fun Christmas movie for the family to watch, with some scenes that make you chuckle out loud and others that will make you smile. That's what I was looking for and that's what I got.Old characters from the original making an appearance was good to see, but only adults could make that link. Younger kids wouldn't have a clue and why should they care. It's nostalgia for the old folks watching, a reminder of when we were young and felt exhilarated by booby traps and getting one over on the bad guys. Just like the young kids today will feel watching this movie, which is set in their modern world with things to which they can relate.I love the original, it's one of the best Christmas movies for kids. I also like this one, not as much, but take it for what it is, remember what it's like to be a kid and just enjoy.

This movie is a rip-off of the original Home Alone movies, it is so bad that it makes Home Alone 6 look like a masterpiece.First of all, the movie totally changes the original plot of the franchise, The kid is the villain not the so called "Robbers". He steals a priceless doll from a family and when they attempt to "steal" the doll back, he calls the cops and blames them. Now to the main character himself, He is an ugly, fat, disgusting, spoiled kid that is a thief and a total loser.The so called "bad guys" in the movie are literally a married couple that are trying to make life good for their kids, the doll that the kid steals from them is priceless and since he stole it, they have a chance at losing their home because they aren't doing too well money-wise.Not only does the kid steal the doll from the family that is struggling, but he also literally calls the cops on them when they come to take it back stating that he thought they were "suspicious".To Conclude this essay, the new Home Alone movie is a cash grab and nothing more, the "traps" that the kid sets have a more horror movie style than a family movie style. This is by far the worst of the Home Alone movies and should not be watched if you don't want to lose braincells, the only reason you should watch it is to be like me and write a horrible review of the movie afterwards. If I would give it negative stars.

reviews.review_title: Not as bad as I thought! You can give it a try
reviews.content: OK! So... It's not as bad as I have been hearing. It's definitely not anywhere close to the original, but it's different. I'll give it that. Also, it's more modern! Which is pretty obvious, but I kind of like it because it feels more like our times now versus the 90s. Of course I wish it had more of original actors coming back, but I got to say the best part of this movie is seeing Buzz again all grown-up. The original actor still plays him the same way! Which I appreciated way more than I thought I would! Now for the elephant in the room. I will say the only huge downside of this new film is the fact that they victimize the bad guys, and make them look innocent and justified. Also I know this sounds corny, but I would've enjoyed the classic trope of this kid being Kevin's son in this movie or something rather than this being a completely different family altogether. I know they did that in the third and fourth films as well but I think it really would've been better off in this film versus those movies if they at least had a cameo for Macaulay Culkin in this! Like I said it's not terrible, and it's not disappointing. It's just a completely different time and family now in this film. I would still recommend giving it a try but it's not gonna be the original.

If this story line has been written by students, maybe they would get a C. But instead, it was approved by millionaire studio execs and produced by people that are highly unqualified for their jobs. The circle of stupidity continues. In an artistic field, if management has no talented and unqualified for their industry because all they did was bring coffee to someone for 5 years before being given a producer title, they do not have a clue whether or not the art of the writer, director, DP or editor is of good quality or not. I am sure there are wonderful writers and producers that would make a great film but alas they were not friends with the right group of morons. These days all the expert real talent in LA ends up on YouTube instead of being hired by execs that actually need them.

Here's the deal I'm 21 and I watched parts of home alone as a kid but I was never into it. I watched this movie and it's as good as other kids movie. The problem is that some people have very strong connections to the original film and they are not easy to satisfy. But if you have a kid whos not emotionally connected to the original then they will enjoy it.

reviews.review_title: I made an account to write this terrible review
reviews.content: I've never been compelled to write a movie review, but today is the day. This movie was so bad, the characters are all garbage and the main kid has been written with zero redeeming features and is extremely unlikeable (the character, not the actor) - I'm not sure who we are meant to empathise with, but I feel like I shouldn't be finding everyone (particularly the main character) so grating.This is a mash up of bad writing, mediocre and bad acting and a terrible plot line. Please do yourself a favour and watch the original, or paint dry. Whichever you prefer.

First of all, the movie is so boring, its like watching paint dry.Second, the actors look so forced, and it looks like they are reading cardboard cutouts disintegrating in the rain.Its like they have little to no skills of acting at all.
One of the worst movies I've ever seen. The main character is a brat and the writing is so bad. Don't waste your time watching this. Stick with the first two movies.

Yes they did it again. It's the same old story but there's so many new traps and hilarious ways of hurting the inept house raiders. It starts of a bit slow but stick with it for some really good slapstick action.

... very bad reboot just to add christmas theme movies to the streaming platform...so sad and pathetic...everything is bad in this terrible copy of a good movie, from acting to plot and everything else. Please Disney we all know you can do it better!!! Try again!

reviews.review_title: Goes for nostalgia and can't even nail that
reviews.content: Home alone is understandably a classic film. Who doesn't love the tail of the plucky Kevin McAllister who saves his home from burglars. The director of this film, obviously thought that and made this as nothing but a money making machine that uses the whole premise from the original but uses 'Nostalgia' as an excuse. There's taking elements from the original (like the force awakens and the last Jedi take from empire strikes back) and then there is just blatant copying. I wouldn't have a major problem with that however if they had actually got it right. This film is butchered from the beginning by changing the concept to make it so that the villains have a moral compass and have the right intentions. This in theory sounds good, but what it actually does is make us like the villains. Moreover, we want them to actually succeed. This therefore ruins the central aspect of the film as in the third act where we traditionally see the burglars get badly injured by the booby traps set by the hero we can't enjoy it or laugh, we know these people don't deserve it and that they are only trying to help their family. Even during the sequence multiple times they ask the kid to stop and say they just want to talk. The boy ignores them and keeps shooting pool balls at them. This also further reinforces to us that the so called hero is really rude and takes happiness from others misfortune (Unintentionally he was characterised this way). All in all, a misguided and immoral attempt to remake home alone.

reviews.review_title: Dont try to be Home Alone
reviews.content: Had some actual decent things going for it, but tried too hard to tie to the original Home Alone. This wouldve been better as its own thing, with only the kid left home alone concept. It was actually nice to see the "villains" of the movie not being career criminals, spies, or other such nonsense, and many jokes came so close to actually being funny...so close. All I want for Christmas this year is a little more creativity.

reviews.review_title: Instead of sympathizing with the family that's going through financial issues and trying to make ends meet, the movie wants us to root for the spoiled rich bastard
reviews.content: In the first movie, the robbers are bringing it on themselves because they could totally leave at any time. Nothing is keeping them there, so the suffering they go through is totally their fault.But if they establish that this family is going through financial troubles, and are about to lose their house, and they have good reason to believe that they're recovering their own stolen property that would let them keep their house; yeah no, they kinda can't just leave. It adds a greater weight of emotion to that scene where the lady breaks down in tears after being set on fire, it tells the audience that she feels trapped and has no other options; that those are tears brought on by months of stress culminating in maybe the worst night of her life. That isn't funny unless you're a psychopath.

reviews.review_title: Better than I thought it was going to be
reviews.content: Watched last night with my kids. I have to say it was better than I had expected. I really can't understand some of the other bizarre reviews on here and some of the personal comments about Archie Yates I find disturbing, also remember Home Alone has already had 4 sequels and 3 of them are worse than this installment. As a film I thought it was ok it was never going to be as good or better than the first two films but for what it was was fine and at the end of the day my kids enjoyed it and at the end of the day that's what it is a kids/family movie.

The boy is thief, I guess the root of the story is rust. I stopped watching the film right after the boy stolen the toy. This is not the Home Alone movie I ever known. All movie stuff should think about the source of Home Alone. And if this film is just for money. I have nothing to say but just 1 star to give.

What a terrible film. Premise is awful. A blatant cash grab for desperate actors is the only possible reason this was made. 90 minutes of life that we can't get back. Disney should be ashamed for airing this garbage.

This movie really need to rethink the masterpiece Home Alone 1 was. The whole point of the criminals were that they were stupid and actual criminals so I could laugh at them getting their butts kicked. The so called "criminals" in this move were just a couple trying to get their doll back to sell it and get the money to continue living and feed their children. How could I laugh at them getting their butts kicked when it is actually depressing? Why did they have to make everyone feel bad for them and yet make them seem like the villain at the same time. I honestly don't understand this movie and I think it's time to stop making them. I mean we're at #7 now and they're just getting worse.

They literally made another sequel to this franchise just to make the kid a gleeful sadist where the adults are just trying to get their stuff back.Harry and Marv from the original movies were true bad guys and one felt no shame in laughing at the follies of their own making. But what emotionally balanced person ENJOYS watching the sympathetic mom and dad from the newest remake getting brutally injured to the laugh track of a psychopathic kid, even AFTER they told him they're not trying to hurt him, they just want their property back?!No sympathy for the rude, spoiled kid, and the awful jokes do nothing to make it any more watchable. The only reason I suffered through this bore is because my child wanted to see it, and even he regretted it.

reviews.review_title: Are we really supposed to root for the kid???
reviews.content: Who decided to make the down on their luck middle class family the "bad guys" and the bratty kid from the uber wealthy family the "good guy". I'm about mid way through, but if things don't work out for Elle Kemper in the end this would be in the running for one of the worst movies of all time.

An insult to the original. Almost unwatchable. Please don't.The acting for the most part is shocking. The characters are unlikeable and the humour seems to have been left on the cutting room floor.Christmas movies should be better than this.

reviews.review_title: Why not ruin all my childhood memories disney
reviews.content: This was so bad that i quit after 5mins into the movie.This is an insult to the franchise and the movie industy.Disney you are doing a great job! Thank you for ruining all my precious memories with cheap generic knockoff movies.Keep them coming!

The fact that Devin Ratray is in this and that Macauley Culkin makes me want to get terminal cancer in my nuts. Where is Macauley Culkin, if Devin Ratray is in this why can't Macaulay Culkin be in it. Also the McAlister should have their children taken away from them and get arrested if they keep this up.

This movie is so messy, no way to follow the plot or to understand what the problem is, how to solve it... The characters not only look alike, but their acting is so monotone, boring, lacking any charisma, that it is difficult to relate to them or understand them. Such a comedic cast to achieve absolutely one laugh from the audience. And Kevin or Max, a little boy who looks like a mini adult. Just that. He has no pros or cons in his defence, how do you play a character after MC's incredible performances... this movie couldn't be a more boring one if they had made it bad on purpose.
Best home alone series movie. Good direction, story, visuals etc. Our whole family like it very much. We will recommend everyone to see it with whole family members to enjoy an evening.
The whole point of the Home Alone movies is to watch a kid kick bad people's ass... but in this movie, he does it to good people.Definitely not satisfying as the originals (1 and 2).

reviews.review_title: Knows what it is. Not as good as original 1&2 BUT leagues above any other sequels.
reviews.content: Get over your nostalgia for the original Home Alone 1 & 2. Great, now that's done you can enjoy this movie for what it is: a funny, light-hearted, family movie aimed at kids who aren't pretentious snobs slamming it just because it's not as good as the original. I enjoyed watching it with my kids, we all laughed at several points. One thing we loved was finding the little nods to the original movie. The story was nothing super new or ground breaking but it was good enough. Overall a decent funny family movie to be enjoyed without comparison to its predecessors. If you don't enjoy goofy kid movies then you won't like it.

To be honest I didn't watch the whole movie! My fiance is a fan of the other movies so we figured we would watch it but after about 30 minutes in we couldn't take it and had to turn it off. That was awful.

reviews.review_title: Time I will never get back
reviews.content:
One of the worst movies I have ever watched.An the kid staring in the movie.... Ugh, who paid the director to cast him. A total disaster from start to finish.I am embarrassed for Disney having this on their network
.
This movie has lots of funny moments, amd the plot hangs together. The beginning is a little slow, and the end is overly cheesy. Watchable, parents and kids 13, 10 and 5.

This movie makes no sense!!The kid steals a $200,000 doll from these people. While already coming from a wealthy family. And the people he stole from are treated as the bad guys. But besides that. Just a terrible movie. I was looking forward to see what Disney would do with the home alone franchise.Big fat epic fail.

They used the same premise as the original: terrible family, an awful kid, and a bunch of traps that would definitely kill someone. Would the original do well if released today? Of course not! But it has a time and place in peoples' hearts that no revamp could ever meet. One major flaw?? You feel worse for the "villains" than for the kid. In fact, I rooted for them the whole time. The heart of the original wasn't quite there, even though they tried just a little. I enjoyed the cast. But the story of the film just didn't feel as well thought out as the first two films. Did I absolute hate it? No. Would I watch it again? Probably not.

The first 2 are classics and the 3rd is by no means a worthy sequel but still can be enjoyable if you look at it for what it was but this movie was complete garbage and I wanted the kid to lose and get hurt. I rooted for the "bad guys" who weren't actually bad guys, they were a struggling family trying to get by and then have a heart warming ending where everyone is friends and no one is actually bad. And they did buzz dirty, they made him a slob cop. No respect to the originals.Movies have gotten soft about good and bad characters. Nothing wrong with having real bad guys who mean harm. Makes for a more satisfying ending.I wish I could give this movie -10/10.

Like Star Wars, Disney manages to suck the magic out of this franchise for the sole purpose of making more money for the shareholders. Nothing more, nothing less.Yes it's that bad, or better said: soul less and uninspired. Sure, there will be people that like it but these are not the people that grew up with the fantastic part 1 as a child.I quit my Disney+ subscription, I can't handle this soulless pieces of crap anymore.

I'll ignore all the negative reviews, they aren't worth a single dollar of anything, this movie is amazing. Even if its an RIP off, it does not matter, i'll say Dont stop at all, these movies are fun and worth it. 3 and 4 of home alone where far from same as 1 and 2, nobody got mad for that, but this you gonna be mad for? People nowadays need to stop being mad for a movie. This movie was fun. I dont see any issues here.Watch it before you review it. Its worth it.

reviews.review_title: I have 1000 times more fun working than watching this
reviews.content: A lame rip off of Home Alone.It starts off bad then it gets progressively worse, reaching like a few dozens all time lows.Do not watch it, it is disappointing.

I wanted to see this movie, and just get it over with... and to see the only two Home Alone movies that matter on Christmas day.During the entire movie I was just looking at the screen, without even having a laugh, or a good time for that matter... minus one single scene that actually gave me a smile, and that because Ellie Kemper is funny.I am not recommending watching this film, if you do no want to be disappointed.If you want your youngling to see a Home Alone movie, the first two are the only ones that matter. Period. And maybe the third one.The kid was obnoxious in this movie, and completely lacks that Kevin's charm, the kid from the third one is much cooler than this one, to be fair.The movie is not funny, and you are just staring at it without having bit of fun.The entire movie is lacking that Home Alone comedy and vibe... it is hollow...
The booby traps are not as smart as they were on the other ones, and here they just feel rehashed.It's a No.

reviews.review_title: Cute movie, but not a Home Alone one
reviews.content: Besides the kid being brattier and FAR more disrespectful than your typical Home Alone protagonist (and yes. More than Kevin. You heard me) and generally merely a tolerable character, this just didn't feel like a Home Alone movie.For one, I get that the other three (we are NOT taking the fourth and fifth into account) were made in the 90s, but this one was painfully, tackily modern - from architecture and furniture to costuming and product placement. At times, the movie felt like one giant ad. I can't explain what made the product placement more prominent than a typical movie, but this one had a few scenes that were shot like ads for car companies.Most of the jokes are great - each break-in scene had me in TEARS laughing - but there are too many quippy Disney-brand one-liners that just don't land.You don't spend enough time with the family, not even the mother. I don't even remember who the father was because he had next to no lines and was just one of the mass of relatives Max had staying with them. The mom is genuine but has very few scenes, so you find it hard to empathize with her, which really is a problem with most of the characters throughout the movie.However, the main problem is the antagonists, who are arguably the protagonists. Pam and - was it Jeff? I had to look it up. It was Jeff - her husband are the part that make this movie feel like it wasn't part of the franchise. I'm not talking about the actors; they played the parts as best they could, but the problem is that you empathize with them. Every home alone movie is clear-cut, black and white, good vs evil. The antagonists are villains that have no sympathetic motivations, and the kid just wants to protect himself and his home from evil people that want to hurt him for profit. That's why they work - that's why you can watch a kid giving grown adults major injuries and laughing about it, and laugh about it yourself. They "deserve" it.Pam and Jeff do not. They just want to keep their family afloat, and they don't even intend to harm the kid - in fact, they struggle a lot with the implications of their unlawful actions! This makes watching them slip, slide, burn, and break bones simply painful. Sure, it's hilarious, but you can't get the horror of watching this happen to the protagonists out of your mind while it's happening. Because really, they are the protagonists. You spend just as much time, if not more, with them as you do with Max, and you understand and care about them much more!The resolution is painful to watch as well - you're telling me you befriended the kid that just spent hours putting you in the hospital? You're telling me you spend Christmas together??? No. Nope.Altogether, it's cute, but that's about it. That and the humor win it 3 stars for me, but my nephews loved it enough that I have to give it 4.

The 3.6 rating, at the time of writing, is honestly too high. Many people will read these reviews and watch this garbage anyway, and they deserve what they get. I get it...If I had come here first, I probably would have still watched it anyway, too. That's why I forced myself to sit through all 95 minutes, accepting it as penance for some past misdeed.
What a horrible movie. Bad casting, acting and you can tell they try so hard to make some of the scenes funny but failed. Don't watch it, it's a waste of time.

So.... who exactly is the bad guy in this movie? Apart from the kid being literally obnoxious, you can't root for him on the part that he was the reason for the home invasion. HE IS A THEIF.I can't believe this movie had a budget let alone made it into production. Don't waste the time.

This movie. Is. TERRIBLE. I'm unsure what the need was to make a sixth installment of such a loved franchise. My daughter has absolutely loved Kevin since she was three. We have watched the original and second movies many many times and still they are enjoyable. But, there was no reason to make this "movie." The "plot" is just awful, there are no redeeming qualities. There is not a laugh to be had, every move is predictable.Let's leave a classic alone and stop trying to remake the same thing over and over again.

My daughter is an avid watcher of the original Home Alone and wanted to watch this new installment... I will never get this time back. This is hands down one of the worst movies I have seen. Seriously, don't waste any time!!!
Really, the only thing interesting about the movie was the music, which is in every other Christmas move. This movie brought nothing to the table. Thank God it was free.

This movie is so bad I seriously question the creative forces behind it. The story is predictable. And the stones are simply painful to watch. But the absolute worst part of this movie is the little boy. Macaulay Culkin was cute. This boy is obnoxious. Totally unlikable.

I don't like the general theme of it's just normal parents coming into the house where they think is a stolen doll. The kid stole the doll?? The parents aren't criminal master minds. It doesn't have any scenes from Chicago which they keep saying they live in winnetka, IL - where the first 2 Home Alone movies are filmed (the famous brick house). It doesn't even look like Chicago's North Shore. Best part of the movie is when Buzz shows up. I was pretty pumped for this movie and was a pretty big let down. I did think it did have some cute parts, and corny of Christmas stuff that's why I gave it a 5.

reviews.review_title: Really really wanted to hate it.
reviews.content: But I couldn't.. The villains were actually not evil and had a legit reason to be in the house and were likeable. Lil Peter Griffin is no Kevin but I enjoyed him. Nice that the McCallister family exists in this universe as well.

reviews.review_title: One of the worst movies ever made
reviews.content: Attention Disney Plus, quality > quantity. Don't follow the Netflix model of maximum volume of content even if it's total garbage like this is. Why not do something clever like have Macauleh Culkin reprise his role?

This movie was so bad it was entertaining. If you watch this movie with low expectations you will LOVE this best bad movie.A highlight of this film is the facial expressions that were extremely exaggerated.

reviews.review_title: What is there left to say
reviews.content: I would be writing a review about this right now, but there is quite literally nothing to say about it. Watched this movie with my mom looking to make fun of a stupid Disney sequel, but came out wishing to unsee what I had just saw. This movie is one of the few movies out there that makes me wish I could pluck out my eyeballs and roast them with a rotisserie chicken.

Whoever approved this script and green lit this project should lose their job.An absolute atrocious premise and other than a few quite humorous nods to the original movies this has no place in modern cinema.
OK So the first 25 minutes are good in my opinion but then it goes on a rapid decline from then on until its at a point where I cant bear to watch anymore.
This is the baddest movie ive ever seen. Dont watch it people. Hoe can you make so stupide movie. I wasted 1,5 hours of my life. It dont Comes by the original home alone.

Really good movie, good actors. Better than 3, 4 and 5. Good main actor, kid been in many movies already, Ellie Kemper is always good too. They even mentioned Kevin and his brother appear in this movie.

reviews.review_title: Good movie, but completely different from the original.
reviews.content: This movie needs to be appreciated on its own, not compared to arguably the most iconic movie of all time.I don't understand why all the complete hated for this movie, but it's obviously biased.The acting is good, the storyline is unique, and the budget was clearly healthy.Try to watch this movie with a fresh perspective and you'll enjoy it.The problem seems to be that everyone is comparing it to the original...so stop it!

reviews.review_title: Man this was hard to watch
reviews.content:
Why Disney? Why did you ruin a classic? Smh...
The movie is boring, tries too hard to replicate the fun of the classic but nope. It is hard to watch. Everything because an expensive doll lol.

reviews.review_title: It is not disappoing...because I knew that this was a disaster.
reviews.content: Take Home Alone, remove all of the human connections and emotions. Build a home in a studio and write some idiot script around building whith a kid and some Macguffin (a doll), what the neighbours want to take back from the kid.The original wasn't the smartest film, but at least it was funny and it has a heart. There was a mother who wants her kid back, the strange killer neighbour, who actually s a very good person. There was John Candy.In the new one all of the human connections are lost. The acting was over the line, even the protagonist Archie Yates, who is a nice kid, bad his acting here is really bad. But it is not his fault. In this film everybody and everything is bad. Even the cameo from the original movie placed here stupidly.Thank you disney, you kill everything for a couple dollars.

The kid was obviously the villain of the movie, the couple just wanted what the brat stole from them. Would give this a one star if i could. Would not recommend if you enjoyed the other home alone movies, even if you didnt, don't bother on this one.

The only good thing in this movie was Erin, it's also even uncomfortable to watch, at least a few scenes, lots of holes and your sympathy is going to be with the burglars... of a hose where a kid is a lone. I didn't like it at all.

Better than these reviews suggest. I've seen the first 2 about a hundred times over the last 30 years and have never had an interest in the straight to dvd sequels. My kid wanted to see this one and going in with low expectations I was pleasantly surprised. Decent budget, decent cast and a few nods to the original. Worth a watch.

Turned it off after 20 minutes. It was a bunch of good actors playing ridiculous roles. Don't know why the cast who they did. Did not make the main character likeable. Couldn't stomach to watch anymore!

Everything the original does, this remake does bigger and with less humor. There are too many characters, too many subplots, too many efforts at funny business that fall flat. It's awkward from beginning to end, although if you're like me you'll be tired of the film 10 minutes into it.

reviews.review_title: Not what I thought it would be based on trailer
reviews.content: I gave it a 6/10, its an ok movie, has some good call backs to the original. Trailer made me think it was going to be something completely different and it ended up being better than I thought it would be.

reviews.review_title: Didn't expect too much and it was as expected
reviews.content: I would say it had bad acting, no Christmas feeling, monologue was predictable and in most cases, not related to the anything, just so that its there. There really isn't anything to add.

reviews.review_title: Made an account just to downrate this
reviews.content: Absolutely terrible movie about a spoiled brat kid. The humor was poor, the "traps" were painfully masochistic, and this had absolutely none of the charisma and creative quick wit of the original movie. I watched it more so to see how cringy it was and it just left me mad that someone actually OK'ed this plot and thought it would make for a good movie. I've never reviewed a movie but I actually went out of my way here just to give this a poor review if that gives you any idea how terrible of a movie it actually was.

reviews.review_title: The true essence of the Disney+
reviews.content: The humor and references are about as subtle as a sledgehammer to the forehead, the family dynamics are confusing and wholly unrealistic, and the movie is about 25 minutes too short. By those standards, this is your average Disney+ original movie. I don't really see what you were all expecting with this. It was never going to be the next Paddington 2, but by Disney+ standards it's actually pretty good.

reviews.review_title: Not a one star but don't bother watching
reviews.content: It really wasn't a good movie. They tried way to hard to update the story in many ways but keep some of the core parts the same. Because of this, they ended up with a movie that had terrible reviews.As you watch it, it feels so uncomfortable because the character motivations don't make sense and how the characters act also don't make sense.The cameo was nice, some of the acting was good, some of the jokes were even laugh out loud funny. But yet, it was all just too forced and not executed well.

Please Don't watch. This movie lacked everything the other Home Alone films had. Kid was the worst. The villians were just misunderstood. Police Department decided to let Buzz be a cop, because this department doesn't hire the best people to be police officers. There is no good lessons to be learn. No older characters to mentor this kid. Would be zero if I could.

Aisling is one of my favourite comedians I'm so sad that she was in this soul sucking movie. Watching it on Disney plus I was gasping, ney, PLEADING for a playback speed feature (if there is one I can't find it) Home Sweet Home was just so painful to set my peepers on. The writing was horrible, the recycled slapstick from the early 90's atrocious WHO AM I KIDDING ALL OF IT WAS CRAMP INDUCING!!!Aisling showed up and did the damn thing like good for her she's collecting her bag. Her acting was chefs kiss as always. Everyone else ._. Unmentionable I don't want to talk about it. I don't want to relive it.Dear ENTIRE industry please stop making home alone movies they get worse with each one they are no longer cheese fun little movies to watch and laugh at with friends over the holidays they are what I would consider the 7 circle of hell movies. I'm not going to be able to sleep tonight...I don't think I'll ever sleep again.

reviews.review_title: Not as good as the Original, but definitely not as bad as the 4th.
reviews.content: It has a somewhat of a twist ending with Both Families of Pam and Carol coming together after the doll was given to Pam by Max. It honestly had no bad jokes except a few Adult not Understanding and Using Kid Jokes.

reviews.review_title: IMDB 3.2/10 is too harsh it's enjoyable
reviews.content: At the time of this review IMDB scores it 3.2/10 this is way too harsh. If you're being nostalgic and comparing this to the original films you might be inclined to give it a low score but judge it on its own merit and it is an enjoyable film.

reviews.review_title: Far, far better than I was expecting
reviews.content: There's a lot of hate for this film, which I don't understand. I'm a child of the 80s, and the original 'Home Alone' was one of the first films I ever saw at the cinema. I loved it, and the (entirely predictable but brilliant) 'Home Alone 2: Lost in New York' that followed. Both written by the 80's legend John Hughes. I've re-watched both many times, and was highly skeptical of this new edition. Every sequel there has been since the first two films has been terrible, but I was pleasantly surprised with this!I think the acting is great, and the motivations of all individuals is largely logical (granted, at points that is a stretch). It's no more absurd than the original two (perhaps at points less so).I was surprised it was still almost as jovially violent as the original, which added to the enjoyment - and there were many moments that made me laugh out loud. There is also some disguised adult humour, which I won't spoil by quoting here, particularly with the Smart-device in the home.Great cameo from the actor who played Kevin's brother Buzz in the original too - and this wasn't just a nod, it actually significantly added to the panning out of the plot.All round very entertaining for all ages, and I'd recommend :-)

A lot of people are comparing this to the original and because of that are bashing the film. However, like one reviewer said if you look at it as a stand alone film it is actually a cute film. Was I laughing out loud as much as I did with the original as an 8-year-old? No, but did I enjoy it? Yes! The main difference in my humble opinion is that I actually feel worse for the "bad" guys than the kid. The kid does bother me though at times though. It has a very nice cameo too. Not spoiling anything though.
Absolutely terrible movie. Awful acting, poor script, totally boring. Don't even bother to waste your time watching this. Just stick to the original and don't waste 1-2 hours of your life!

Absolutely zero sympathy for the kid. Steals a family heirloom, and the rightful owners want it back. Why should I feel sorry for the kid?I like both Rob Delaney and Ellie Kemper in lots of other shows, so I'm unsure why they decided to do this film.

I think people see the title and feel like it has to be like the original home alone. If you take the movie for what it is, it's a great holiday movie! Our family of four were happy with it and didn't go into it with the idea it was a redo. The Easter eggs were a fun touch!

But after watching Home Alone 4 (which was the worst movie I have ever seen) This wasn't bad at all.All the kids did a great job!Good attempt is what I'd say, and awesome to see the real Buzz in the policeman role (his food habits haven't changed a bit).I don't think any movie can beat the first and second movie which easily is a 10/10 from me. It had synergies that are very rare these days, and we're not likely to ever get that magic back.I initially thought about 6 stars, but it had a vibe to it at the end that I really enjoyed.

reviews.review_title: WOW, People are just rating this movie unfairly
reviews.content: THIS movie is such a great holiday movie not like the original but still lot of work done to perfect this movie yet people are judging it like they could do any better. Anyway Directors did so well. KUDOS!!

Found myself rooting for nobody in the movie! Cheered when I turned it off. This was an awful movie that nobody asked for. Giving it 1 star is being VERY generous! Top 5 dumbest holiday movies ever made.

U got a billion dollar franchise here ... almost -- and this is what thay give us .... pushing it on disney+ like blockbuster ... its sad and a huge scam... Please make this 100Mil movie and fire it up ! I dont get it...

No it would never touch the original so not quite sure why people are disappointed in that respect..
But it was funny , cheesy and a de ent family movie...

Devin Ratray's(now Officer Buzz McCallister) return is this movies ONLY saving grace! This movie does deliver some minor laughs but goes to show you should never mess with a CLASSIC.Buzz McCallister is literally THE ONLY reason I tuned into this sequel. It brought back such awesome memories of the first two Home Alones and all of he and Kevin's ingenious antics and adventures.It was also interesting to learn that Kevin(McCallister) owned the security company protecting the home of the newest Jr. Break-in victim. As well as the Buzz's revelation that Kevin enjoyed making prank Police calls to Officer Buzz pretending there was a child left home alone at the same address in reference to the two times he was separated from his family during the Christmas holiday.Other than that bit of nostalgia, this movie was not worth watching. It was an extremely poor attempt at reviving a classic which simply cannot be outdone. There will NEVER be another Kevin McCallister, Buzz McCallister, McCallister FAMILY or Marv and Harry. Can't revive a classic that never died in the first place. D+ for effort.

I'll be honest with you, when I first heard of this new version(as it is not a remake or a reboot) I was very weary of it. But after 20 minutes of watching it, I fell in love. It is well written, well acted, with a lot of humour. What a great script, taking this iconic story and re-dressing it. And how fantastic to have Buzz (Kevin's older brother) do a cameo, not to mention seeing the McCallister security sign and alarm mentioned. The couple, who are supposedly the "bad guys" are so funny. They don't take away from Pesci or Stern, but add their own comedic timing.This is a definite must see!!! For me and my family, we will be adding this to our Christmas classic movies we watch yearly.

No reason for this film, just yet another remake that robbed from the original and still fell flat. The entire premise makes zero sense and the film was just terrible. The ending was OK, but the rest was garbage.

New cast, parents are funny and go through some 2020's issues. Ellie Kemper is hilarious as usual and brings her comedic chops from the Office.. They bring back Buzz from the originals...what's not to love? Not as iconic as the first 2 but this is a good family friendly movie for the holidays. Kids love it!
Please don't watch this movie. The movie has no charisma, the actors are no actors, the home alone kid has a punchable face. Very annoying. This movie should be buried very deep in the ocean.

reviews.review_title: Low expectations, and still not met.
reviews.content: An entirely unlikable cast, including the "Kevin" replacement who you find yourself rooting against after the first scene. There is no cuteness like the original, and no redeeming message. After watching this movie you will see the reality of the story, and have no further hope for society.

I could only survive watching half of it. It's absolutely horrible and a total disgrace for the Home Alone franchise. Failed attempt at "modernizing" the original Home Alone, yet losing everything there was good about it. It has a bizarre casting, awkward storyline, lame acting and dialogues. It shouldn't have been allowed to use some of the original music score in it, too!

Rhe original is a classic so i wasn't expecting much but i loved the actors, the story line. The why and how's this could happen in the year 2021.Truly an enjoyable movie with the kids with a good christmas spirit.

reviews.review_title: Everything wrong with the modern world in 90 minutes
reviews.content: So here we are again, another Disney cash grab and my word they grabbed some cash in this movie, product placements for bmw, nordtrack, McDonald's, Uber amongst others. This kind of caper should be out of place in a family film but makes perfect sense in this picture.Let's not forget the ever present woke elements, multiracial family (laughably predictable) check, the ever present useless retarded dad who is a bumbling unemployed failure check. Headstrong working mum check, feral children with no respect for adults check (shot in the face with nerf guns). Why are these same tired tropes given air time in every movie... why???The fat speccy eyed English kid was obnoxious, rude and could illicit no other emotion than distain from the viewer. In stark contrast Kevin was an affable cheeky warm hearted kid and you cared about his actual well-being.You also felt for Kevin's mum in the original as there was actual narrative to her despair at losing her child and her efforts to reunite with him at enormous physical and emotional cost to her. This is a story arc and illicites feeling for her character, this element is completely missing in this version, she has a Karen, gets a flight and hates the fat guy next to her on the flight home.Just do yourself a favour and watch our 1990 version and feel good about yourself and your family!

Obviously never going to be as good as the first 2 movies, the bad guys made those films.My 6 year old has even put them as her favourite Christmas films EVER! But this movie she lost interest after 5 minutes, it takes a long time to get the fun antics and even they fall short of funny. I can't see this being remembered in years to come.

Spoilers but honestly who caresThe New English Kevin is the most unlikeable kid in a movie since Macaulay starred in The Good Son. My favorite example of this is when he visits a church running a charity drive for kids and leaves with a brand new toy gun to bring back to the mansion he's staying in alone.Disney is trolling us with this one, fam. We got got.

There isn't much to like about this movie. The kid is very unlikable he is rude, selfish and spoiled. He is horrible from the start, insulting to a struggling family and then stealing from them. Why should I think anything he is doing is funny when he is the bad guy in this movie.

I can agree that this movie is bad. A little spoiler here.. The antagonist is the kid itself. This movie show so many bad example, and also bad acting during the house trap. If you watch this with your kids. Better tell them which one is good and which one is bad. What the kid do in the movie is bad. The ending is not bad for a family movie, but still bad thou.
Trash, trash, double trash... I guess the review needs 150 characters. If you make the movie about a kid, at least make the kid not a stupid little brat...

reviews.review_title: I honestly cannot believe SNL writers wrote this.
reviews.content: They completely lost all the charm of the first one while making the kid even worse and pure evil. Maybe they just hated the kid in the original so they gave him innocent targets to show how bad he really is? This rich prick of a kid steals from a poor couple with a family, the couple tries to get their important stolen item back, and the kid basically tries to kill them (like in the OG).The key differences here are the attacks feel unjustified and cruel. They are not in self-defense, they are out of ignorance posing as self-defense. It makes the movie incredibly difficult to watch. There is no balance in the characters. Sure, Kevin McAllister was no angel, of course, but his badness was outweighed and even made necessary by the evilness of the two Chicago thugs trying to rob his house and kill him.That made all those gags bearable to watch. That made Kevin sympathetic and impressive, even though he was doing bad things. He was doing bad things because he had to and he was a kid processing a survival scenario the only way he knew how.This movie muddled all of that. There's no balance in it. The kid is disproportionately evil in this case, and it doesn't matter that he does something nice for them in the end. You can't even make it through to that part (I had to fast forward). I expected better from Mikey and Streeter. I trusted them to remake this classic and do it justice and what a major let down. Now, I'll know to skip their next film. My creative heart is broken on so many levels right now. I'm not even mad, I'm just disappointed.

reviews.review_title: Disney gave New life to The Home Alone Series
reviews.content: I've been a huge fan of Home Alone 1 & 2 since they were released in the theaters & saw both in the theater & have watched them every year since. Then they came out with Home Alone 3 & the last Home Alone movie to be released in the theater. I went to see it & I was so disappointed with what they did with the Home Alone series but then it only got worse when Home Alone 4 & 5 were released. They got increasingly worse as they came out so when I saw Disney Plus was doing a new Home Alone movie "Home Sweet Home Alone" I went in with the mindset that it is going to be as bad as Home Alone 3-5 BUT I was hoping that because it was Disney that they would put the magic back in the Home Alone movies & they absolutely did & I was so excited. Home Sweet Home Alone Is funny has a great story, great acting & I was so excited that they brought back a main character from Home Alone 1 & 2 & they make many references to part 1 & 2.If you're a fan of Home Alone 1 & 2 then you will love Home Sweet Home Alone.Like Home Alone 1 & 2 Home Sweet Home Alone will become a part of my yearly Home Alone Christmas movies. Please ignore & skip Home Alone 3-5 & just watch Home Alone 1 & 2 & 6 "Home Sweet Home Alone"

As a huge fan of the originals and since it's a staple of my childhood, I've watched all the other bad versions that came after - so I didn't expect much from this one to start with. The poor reviews are all accurate but I'll give this one an extra star because it truly just felt like a parody. It had some funny moments and honestly the movie wasn't so bad up until the booby traps. That whole part with the traps was unnecessary & like the other reviews said, it literally made you feel sorry for the "bandits".The cast all did a good job, Ellie Kemper kept the movie alive though & the special guest appearance was probably my favorite part of the whole movie. Watch this with very low expectations and you might actually be pleasantly surprised instead of severely disappointed.

Flora & Ulysses at a 6.3 and this a 3.6 is an absolute joke. I have a 3 year old. He wanted to watch it so yeah. People are trying to compare this to home alone... obviously it's no where near that level. I normally wouldn't give this the light of day but am surprised how low people rate it. Just know that it's not home alone. It's a different story. Yes it's super corny. But there is so much worse out.

reviews.review_title: Time I will never get back
reviews.content: A movie so bad I wish I'd had something to hand to poke my eyes out. I feel like Disney should pay me back for the time I wasted watching this. Had to give it one star as I couldn't give it less. Staring at the corner of the room would have been more entertaining than this movie. Also max the main character is not likeable in comparison to Kevin from. The original. I wanted Max to get caught, if this had happened the movie may have got two stars.

Another terrible move sequel in a long sad history of terrible move sequels. I watched it thinking it can't be that bad, but it is, it is that bad. It's as though you have this numbness in watching it. You think it can't get worse, and it does. You still delude yourself into thinking it will get better an somehow it fails you again. Then the movie ends, and you have this stunned sense of how could they make such a terrible move. That's when it helps if you remember 2 words "Cash Grab". This is the only way you can justify the train wreck that you just witnessed. Please, save yourself the trauma and subsequent therapy required for watching such garbage.
All I'm going to say is that first I don't like having a British kid as the main character and having a woman as a robber is just weird and the movies just not that good.

Idk why there are so many Debbie Downers about this movie but I thought it was great, far better than any other sequel. The only reason I can tolerate the second one is because of Tim Curry. This storyline is cute and not an exact copy of the original so that gets bonus points from me. The perfect way to revamp the original franchise without just blatantly redoing it. The other sequels beyond that are, naturally, terrible. Of course it's not going to be in the ball park of the OG because it was *that* good to those of us who grew up with it and have sentimental value over it. But is it really THAT bad, to have 3.5 stars? Not a chance. People just love to hate 🤷‍♀️
This entire thing is just another cash grab attempt by using the same movie name even after the last remake bombed. There's no point in making 6 movies of pretty much the same thing.

Nothing will be as good as the first two but this did a great job for a 2021 Home Alone movie. There were tons of little Easter egg moments. It was funny. The parents were great and relatable. People giving it a bad review and saying it's terrible wouldn't have been happy unless they just watched Home Alone 1990 again. It was similar enough to be considered a Home Alone movie and different enough to not seem like a repeat. They were smart to focus more on the desperate parents opposed to the kid because no one could pull off what Macaulay did but the child actor in this was still great. Give it a try with an open mind and you might be surprised!

Might be the worst remake of anything i've ever seen. This movie made me geniunely angry.What made the originals so good, was the main kid having a bunch of charm to counter his bad characteristics. This kid has none of that, he's just a big pile of garbage, with no charm at all.You have zero reason to be against the "villains" in this one, at most points i wished the kid would be the one to get hurt.Can't stress enough how much of a waste of time this is to watch, i wouldn't even wish this on my worst enemy.Wish it was bad in a funny way, but all i got was pain.

reviews.review_title: Poor poor acting not funny waste time
reviews.content: Worst Disney I've seen. Slow, boring, not even funny. Nothing like should have been! Can't beat the first one ever. They try to have a few faces in from the original but didn't work. Expect it be more fun, the baddies wasn't even bad. Just bad start finish. Can't remake a good oldie turn in to crumbs.

Child of the 80's here. I watched the original when it was a new release and loved it from childhood to present at a "christmas favorite" movie. I thought this particular movie was only a VERY slight nod to the original(kid is alone, adults get beat up lol) i enjoyed the quirky plot and chara ters and think its 100% worth a watch.

From the beginning of the movie, I knew that the movie was bad and the actors were bad.And whoever chose Max for this role made a very, very bad choice.Is it impossible to make a movie like Home Alone 1 and Home Alone 2? Weird ...

If I could give it negative 5 stars I would. This movie is trash AF!!!!It is a bad copy of the first home alone movie, it is like the screen writer watched the original home alone movie and thought how can I make it worse.They gave the villains a sad backstory and tried to made them misunderstood, this doesn't explain why they make the villains do so many stupid stuff, it was like they got progressively worse. And it wasn't funny when the kid kept hurting them because of their backstory.Meanwhile, there wasn't enough backstory or focus on the kid, they just grab like 2 scenes from the original movies for the kid to reenact and that was it. He literally had 15mins in the whole movie and that was it, and kid's character wasn't like-able. They didn't show him going through any type of emotional journey or having any type of character development, he was a flat character, basically everyone was.On top of all that they just ended the movie with cheesy "heart-warming" scene.Honestly this movie sucks and I wish they could pay me for the time I wasted watching this garbage. I feel like the people who gave this movie over 2 stars hated the movie too but wants you to also waste your time watching it like they did, don't fall for the trap.DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME!!!!!!!!!!!!

reviews.review_title: An ode to the original with a twist
reviews.content: A self-aware spin on the Home Alone story with sympathetic "robbers" (yes, there is a reference to remaking old favourites).Great acting from Rob Delany and Ellie Kemper. Would have liked more of Aisling Bea, she is a great talent.The story was well established as the characters seemed to have motives for their actions.A lovely Christmas movie about family.

Based on the Trailer(didn't watch the the movie )this movie seems to be a parody of the original Home Alone . Even a parody is to much to say , its very sad to see something like this. And yes , based on the actual acting and delivery of the movie, the 1 star review fits .
The little boy was annoying and the whole movie was just annoying. I don't understand why they have to try and remake classics. They are classics for a reason. Let them be!

reviews.review_title: To those saying it's only hated for being a remake
reviews.content: Why, just why. This movie isn't just terrible, it is a senseless cash grab trying to wring out every dollar of a timeless master piece to make a quick buck. It adds nothing new, it ruins classic scenes, and contains some of the worst performances I've ever seen. Terrible, terrible, terrible, the whole idea was bad but the execution makes it that much worse all these actors and producers should be ashamed.

Of course this film will never be as good as the first two, but they even make a joke about this in the film. I did think it would be terrible but there were some funny moments and kept with the original theme. I enjoyed the Easter eggs.

I could have been so good and made Disney loads of money and another franchise but they got lazy.When I read all the bad reviews I thought it could not be that bad.No, its even worse.Why would they even bother making this ?Its really bad. A waste of time,So much potential wasted.

We don´t need to lie to ourselves - the original 2 movies are timeless classics. Started to be worried after watching the trailers.The good thing is it went not to cinemas. And another one - a little reference to first two movies.Can´t say I blame the actors, because the rest was a pure torment. There was no believable chemistry, like nowhere. If you want to give a little "wink" to the source material, you cannot spit on the concept - spoiled brat, clumsy criminals, mysterious figure, which is not as bad as it seems (1 - the neighbour, 2 - pigeon lady). You cannot simply enjoy environment, the characters, the story, if it´s so weak. The end of the movie was so cheesy ("criminals" turned to good) it makes you wanna vomit.All you can do with this movie is the same as with nuclear waste - bury deep and forgot it ever existed.

Maybe you have to be a kid-haver to find this amusing, but all the negative reviews on here are being a bit dramatic. Let's face it, for a pandemic movie, this isn't all that bad. Theres been plenty of junk peddled in movies and TV (La Brea, that show is such junk). This movie has enough jokes and silliness for all ages. Give it a whirl, you might enjoy it.
Forget the first movie... same-same but different.The jokes are funny, which great one-liners.I thought I was going to hate it, but I really enjoyed it.

reviews.review_title: I wasted an hour and a half just watching is catastrophe
reviews.content:
They have totally made a all-time-favourite into a class 5 disaster. The storyline is just so annoying to watch, I mean how can he be that selfish and suddenly turn into a hero for no reasons? And how can the directors turn 2 people who are at a loss to mend their family into the "viallains"??? Adding a hymn in a hilarious scene where you are supposed to make people laugh???And how irnoic, a character said why people wanted to remake the classics, they would never be as good as the original
The only thing i felt was good is that the hint about Buzz and the old McCallisters's sotry.

reviews.review_title: One of the worsts movies ever made!
reviews.content: One of the worst movie ever made a cheap copy of the original movie Alone at Home Very poorly done movie.I had to stop halfway through I couldn't see anymore the movie is horrible.

reviews.review_title: Can't give it zero, so 1 star it is.
reviews.content: Hot garbage. Not everything Disney touches turns to gold. The child who played 'Max' is a grumpy, curmudgeonly, slightly evil and overall unfunny actor. This is like a copy of a copy of a copy using very low quality film. I do not recommend watching this movie, even on a dare. Save your 90 minutes.

The most disgusting film, the most mediocre actors.I believe that this outrage cannot be considered a part of the story of "Home Alone", which ended in 1992. How dare the creators of this disgrace even covet the music from the original film ?!In general, guys, it's just 0 out of 10.I absolutely do not recommend it to anyone, save your nerves (because this squalor just pissed me off).

reviews.review_title: If only it's not titled "Home Alone"..
reviews.content: A nice, fun Christmas movie to watch along with the wholr family. I think if only it's not made as part of the Home Alone franchise, the review score would be better. Adding the original Home Alone soundtracks here and therr kinda bring back memories and worth +1 score for me.
Sucks, if Hollywood can't come up with a new movie, they need to stop trying to build off originals that were hits. Ridiculously stupid, time I can Never get back!

The kid is the bad guy and the wet bandits are the good guys. I like how Buzz McCallister made a cool come back as a cop. The booby traps are more deadly than the first movie instead of lightbulbs it is legos.

reviews.review_title: Disney, you better dedicate yourself to the ucm
reviews.content: Better to see the original, this saga died when the third movie came out, I'm going to give it one more star just for the part in which the child says "I'm tired of this" since it made me laugh and represents what I felt when I saw this film.

reviews.review_title: The worst film I've seen in a long time!
reviews.content: I appreciate they weren't trying to make a reboot/sequel, but this lacks all the charm of the original 2 movies.Not a single laugh! Cheap lazy script, terrible direction...and I know it's a horrible thing to say...but I don't think I've ever wanted to punch a 10 year old kid so much in my life! What a complete waste of an hour and a half!

reviews.review_title: I wish that I can give this movie a negative score
reviews.content: What made the original movie endearing was Macaulay Culkin and a good script. This movie has neither. I love the main actors but they could not save the movie.

reviews.review_title: Not as bad as people are saying
reviews.content: Yaeh I know this isn't better than the original but this was not worst than the 4th nor 5th movie they made. It's a decent movie. The one thing that i didnt like was the actors were trying too hard to be funny. But overall I think this a nice Christmas movie to watch with your family or by yourself. Go watch the WHOLE ENTIRE MOVIE THEN PUT AN RATING ON FOR THIS MOVIE.

reviews.review_title: Pass on this, stick with the original or another holiday film.
reviews.content: Disappointing movie although I think the acting was good considering the weak material. The antagonists had more redeeming qualities than the protagonist in this film.Spoiler....A family is forced to sell their home due to the father's loss of employment, they have an opportunity to avoid this if they can sell a rare doll they own however it is stolen by the protagonist (kid) who tortures them with traps as they try to retrieve it. He reminded me of Dennis the menace rather than Kevin McAllister as Kevin was trying to stop burglers whereas this kid stole and every time the husband/wife tried to explain the situation he deployed another trap.Early in the movie a joke is made about how sequels are terrible which I wonder was a way of letting the writers inform the audience of how bad the film was.

reviews.review_title: Original In All The Wrong Places
reviews.content: When Max misses his rich family's trip to Tokyo, he is left to fend for himself in a tacky and cheap remake of the original.It's hard to not compare the two, especially when the movies leans so much on the link. Through quotes, references and cameos, this most recent release fumbles through it all.The set looks cheap, the cameras look they've been using drones to record the footage. Acting is poor but I feel that's more down to the terrible script. The jokes miss every timeLet's talk facts though, the kid is a little brat. Self entitlement against a working class family trying to save their home. Who comes up with this? It's hot garbage.

reviews.review_title: both the filmmakers and I shouldn't have bothered with this
reviews.content: When I first saw the trailer for this movie, the kid didn't strike me as very interesting - no charisma to speak of, no charm or anything I could really grab onto that would make me want to see more. Still, I assumed when I watched the full movie, more of his character would come through because how could it not? "Oh, now I get what the filmmakers saw in him" I'd no doubt be saying. Well, whatever it was never made it on screen. It seems that the people behind this movie accidentally thought that turning the formula on its head would make up for the lack of originality inherent in doing a reboot - that is, they made the criminals the protagonists. Consequently, there's more attention given to the burglers and making them sympathetic and the kid is more one-dimensional and there just to fulfill the minimum requirement of the premise and set some house traps. There aren't really many scenes devoted to get to know him or get a sense of his perspective on the world, so there's nothing that makes you root for him.There are also a number of things that just seem to fill time and don't really go anywhere. The kid wanted some McDonalds early on in the movie and was denied, so you might figure when he's on his own, there will be a shot in the montage where he's eating some McDonalds or maybe a scene where he ventures out and has an amusing exchange with a McDonalds cashier or Doordash driver. Nope. Nothing. Granted, those wouldn't be great jokes or anything, but this movie is too stupid to even attempt paying off its own dumb setups. Then there was something about a teenage girl (the burgler couple's daughter I think) getting some expensive dress that showed a lot of shoulder. So you'd think maybe she'll get some kind of arc and learn something about being materialistic or trying to impress people. No. She just kind of wears it to a performance and then nothing at all happens. Why they heck did you even show me anything about this dress in the first place? Everything just fizzles out and goes nowhere.Back to characters though. Much of the humor in the original two movies was derived from characters. For instance, Uncle Frank trying to get his wife to steal the silverware on their flight. It's funny because you understand what kind of guy that is and how such a CHARACTER behaves in different situations. In this new one, all of the extended family are just quippy interchangeable nobodies with no discernible personalities or characterstics to speak of - apart from maybe you get the sense they were raised on sitcoms. I didn't look up who wrote this but it seems like it was probably a team of writers impressed with their own cleverness and they just switched over from twitter dot com to their screenwriting app for a few minutes and couldn't be bothered to switch up the style. There's room for a character like that, but having so much of the movie's jokes coming from self-impressed smug people trying to be funny instead of characters who are normal people reacting to crazy situations in funny ways really hurts this type of movie. The whole lot them cancel each other out and they become forgettable and tiresome.Along those same lines, there's a weird thing movies do nowadays where they have to draw attention to jokes and have the characters narrate to you in case you are too stupid to get it. Yes I understand that when your feet are on fire and then you are walking in the snow it is hot and then cold. I've seen fire and snow before. I know what happens there. Are you trying to think of how you'll phrase it on social media later or something? Film is a pretty visual medium and there's a lot to be said for showing rather than telling. Trust the audience a little more.I liked watching Daniel Stern and Joe Pesci get beat up more than I like seeing Ellie Kemper get beat up though. I'm more indifferent to Rob Delaney but these new people never threatened a kid and were made to be sympathetic, so the big payoff at the end is just not nearly as satisfying. Another thing on that note, I don't know what it was about these traps that made them forgettable but maybe part of it was you weren't really seeing bad guys get their comeuppance. It just felt sort of paint-by-numbers and uninspired.There was a scene where Ellie Kemper and Rob Delaney are arguing while performing music for some senior citizens. It was meant to be funny but it was just grating. And it just kept going. This goes for most comedy "writing" nowadays, but this seemingly-half-improvised, naturalistic overlapping dialogue stuff doesn't count as a joke. It isn't funny. Why do they keep doing it? It was kind of interesting once or twice fifteen years ago but now it just seems lazy - as if the things they are saying don't need to bother being funny, they just need to have enough syllables to fit the dialogue pattern rhythms.I probably missed something but how the heck did the mom know where to find the kid at the end? He couldn't have left a note because she didn't go home first. That was weird but maybe they explained that when I was out of the room.I guess that's all. It wasn't the worst thing of all time, I mean I did sit through the whole thing. But it's a contender for the most useless.

This movie is a boring one. I thought that it would be a good movie just for being filmed in 2021, but it's just a waste of time. Home alone 6 is just a cheap copy of the first home alone film. Same traps as in the original movie, same mother that forgets her son at home fly at the end of the world and comes back leaving her vacation. I watched the first movie over and over again but this terrible imitation is not even worthy of watching only for once. This star I'm offering to this nonsense is for the end when the "thieves" and the kids family are forgiving each other for the misunderstanding and spend the Christmas together.

reviews.review_title: Give it a chance! It's cute.
reviews.content: The writing was very funny and when we saw it was Mikey Day it all made sense. Go into it knowing it's not the original and just enjoy it. The kid is adorable and the comedy was amazing. Lots of good cast members. We found it enjoyable.

reviews.review_title: Terrible!!! Really bad!!! Should never called this blasphemy HOME ALONE!!!
reviews.content: So a boy allegedly steals a doll.... And this film stole a few of my brain cells. The plot is ridiculous.The original is original for a reason. Should have never called this film Home Alone! This is blasphemy.

reviews.review_title: I will change my rating to 10 if it is scraped out of existence.
reviews.content: Why does this film exist? It's so horrible that it's beyond imaginable. What a mess truly. The film has no redeeming moments. By far the worst of the franchise. They could head in so many directions and even use original casting to bring the franchise back but once again they've dug up an old title and made a hollow, soulless movie.. it looks and feels like a low budget sitcom. Director, cast and production all just dreadful. File this one under "should not have happened" but again in todays industry its about quantity not quality. Everyone involved got paid well but they'll probably regret doing this one later on in their careers..

This movie is so boring and has no soul or Christmas spirit, all it has is a pale chubby English boy... I don't know how more stupid 20th century fox could be to make a home alone movie again... stupid!!I don't know what else to say, the first Home Alone movies from 1990 and 1992 were the greatest, and Macaulay Culkin will never be replaced, and the 1997 one was alright but not nearly as good as the first 2, and 2002 and newer just sucked, don't even get me started.Maybe they were trying something new to make a home alone movie, but failed, let's just leave and stop making home alone movies, the first 2 movies were enough no more please!

reviews.review_title: How much more can you milk it?
reviews.content: Even since the release of Home Alone 3 in 1997, people feel disappointed and it's understandable. Macaulay Culkin made the first two movies original, timeless, and a rewatchable chridtmas movie every year. Families around the world can laugh and enjoy this film to get them in the Christmas spirit. Who doesn't enjoy watching a genius kid outsmart sleazy thieves using boobytraps around his house?My point is, the first two are classic, rewatchable films. Due to its rewatchabiliy, there is no need for a third, let alone SIXTH movie with poorer quality. Do they think bringing back a classic as a lazy modern film which brings no funny memories and is forgettable a smart idea? Not to mention the Home Alone series gets worse for every movie.

If you could rate this no stars I would. Very sad attempt to recreate the original. I wanted the parents breaking in to win and the boy home alone to lose. The whole concept was terrible. Not funny watching the poor parents get hurt.

A Awesome movie really funny lots of funny senses . Worlds best home sweet home alone. Great actress and actors great traps that max sets up. This is my favorite home alone. Max is my favorite character.
I dislike soulless humor/writing and this is a really, really, reeeeeeaaaaaally prime example. Larry David is clever, this is a rude dumbed down world of sociopaths. Disney missed the mark.

Good movie tbh, can't fault it. Have seen the original long ago
would pick this over that plus its added to my yearly rewatch collection.Nb Sorry, your review is too short. It needs to contain at least 150 characters...

reviews.review_title: Something the Gen Z's will like
reviews.content: Fun, goofy Christmas comedy. It's obviously aimed at kids under 16, but it's enjoyable to get into the spirit. Nice touch in having "Buzz" McAllister as the cop to add a little something for fans of the original Home Alone series of movies.

reviews.review_title: Macaulay Culkin must be turning in his grave.
reviews.content: Awful in every respect. Not one thing about this movie worked. Incredibly awkward script. Not funny. Too many characters, not enough character development. The criminals were supposed to be bad, but they weren't. The child was supposed to be likable, but he wasn't. This movie wasn't even about the child--you hardly even know him by the end. Why don't studios give a damn anymore? Slap "Home Alone" on a pile of garbage and you'll still make loads of money. Disgraceful.
