While the ending to this movie was cute and left you with that typical Christmas/festive feeling of everyone coming together and reminiscing, the rest of this movie was disgraceful and would have John Hughes rolling over in his grave a million times over.I was thoroughly disappointed in this movie and to be honest, if my child/children ever spoke to a stranger the way Max did in the beginning of this film or treated them the way he did (so much harsher than the original which should have stopped at the second one but oh no, Hollywood has to wreck everything), they would be grounded for life. I don't recommend this holiday flick at all.

Then this is the movie for you. I do not understand how they could make something as uncharming as this. Full of celebrity cameos that everytime make you feel worse that yet another person was pulled into this disaster of a production.
Holy mother of god that was so painful to watch. No good actors, rubbish story line. How about we just keep the originals as they are. Don't see the need to try and remake classic Christmas movies.

This is an incredible remake of the original Home Alone movie, even down to the fact that a lot of the props were the same as the original and keep an eye out for a guest appearance from the original Home Alone.It could have been slightly better if it was if they had of used better actors/actresses however still amazing for a remake.Ignore the negative reviews just because it's not a blockbuster movie it doesn't mean it's not an amazing film.Well done Disney you never fail to impress people with your movies. My kids loved the film.

I really, really wanted to give this movie a shot, but I had to give up halfway into it. The acting... atrocious. Seriously, horrible.With the original movie, Kevin was a bit of a psycho, but still likable. You could also understand his frustrations, because his family really were kinda jerks. This kid is just a (insert desired expletive). There's nothing really likable about him.The adults breaking in? Not bad people, but they take ineptitude to a new level. And did I mention bad acting? I did? Well, it requires mentioning again, because the guy stinks up the screen.I'll be re-watching the original for Christmas this year, and will try to forget that this version exists.

As a true home alone fan (1 and 2) I thought I'd give it a chance. Boy, was I wrong.First time, I stopped at about 15 minutes (husband couldn't bare to watch any further)...
However, when I start a movie, I want to finish it, so started to watch it later.Had to push myself to keep watching. Sorry for the actors, the chemistry didn't work, and I really didn't have any sympathy for the kid at all. Felt more sorry for the so-called crooks.Ofcourse no one can top Macaulay Culkin.I don't understand why they keep making these blunt movies. Just keep your hand off, it is starting to get really sad. Do us all a favor and stop these trainwrecks..

It's obvious that they tried to make remake of home alone the first movie, but the did it terrible. The kid is mean and selfish, doesn't want to talk to "robbers" even though they wanted to talk about the doll that was stolen from them. He just want's to make them suffer. Robbers aren't even robbers, they just want to get their lost doll so they can pay for the house they live in.

I mean why should someone suffer a lot when they are already bankrupt and lost their source of income. This movie in every possible way is depressing. Not at all a holiday movie. If possible I would give negative rating for this movie. Stealing others things , leaving the child behind, trying to break in , boasting brother what else will this movie have to offer. Utter disappointment.

reviews.review_title: Brat steals a priceless doll and the victim gets beat up.
reviews.content: The storyline is infuriating. A family about to lose their house has to retrieve a doll that a brat stole. Then the brat beats them up when they try to get it back. I got so mad watching it.

People are hating on this because they're comparing it to the original, which yeah is a classic but does that mean you can't appreciate a modern attempt on the story.Even more so, anyone who's a fan of the original home alone movies will love the fact that this is in the same universe. I love how it's been made.And finally, to the people who are getting "offended" by this movie, all I can say is, get a grip. Stop looking to be offended, and just sit back and watch the movie. If you don't like it, crawl back to the comfort of your "classic"

Bloody terrible. No idea which one is worse, the storyline, the directing, or that horrendous acting of every single actor involved. It was truly painful to watch. You just know the movie is bad when you spend half of it just cringing.

So first of all, this movie doesn't feel so much "Christmas-y" like the original.I mildly disliked the fact that the audience doesn't really follow the story of Max, but more of the parents thus making the audience feel like the parents are the protagonists and not Max.I got very disappointed when I found out that Macaulay Culkin didn't have a cameo.

Watch without prejudice and you'll enjoy it. We did. Shame all the bad reviewers can't. Rob Delaney and Ellie Kemper are great. Archie Yates isn't obnoxious. Perhaps could have done more of Aisling Bea.
Prefer the originals 1000 times! We all thought the couple was right to do what they did almost until the end. It's still unclear to me what happened to the doll...

Yes let's root for a spoiled thief of a kid
Totally unlikable kid as the main character. He ruined the whole movie. Total brat.Who ever did the casting needs to be fired.

It was a long time ago that I gave up watching. 37 minutes is enough for me. Acting and text lines are below the level of B production. Nothing looks good, maybe snow on the scene only. I feel sorry for the actors. Watching this is a waste of time .

When I first heard of this movie I rolled my eyes because every Home Alone movie absolutely sucked from Home Alone 3 on. I knew that Devin Ratray who played Buzz in Home Alone and Home Alone 2 was in this one so I figured I would watch for that purpose alone. I will say this is not a good movie but it is worth watching once because they include a TON of Easter eggs that fans of the first two films will appreciate. From the music to certain scenes, there are plenty of them. Having Buzz make a cameo in it was a good thing but it wasn't enough to make this movie good. This will never be a favorite film of anyone who loves the first two movies but it is worth watching once. Even if it's just for the cameo and Easter eggs.
The kid is a brat and unlike Kevin you want him to get his. This whole story line is bad. It was such a bad movie. It was funny in a few places. Waste of my time.
It's a movie for kids, and my kids loved it. It's not great, but it's very watchable. At least my kids didn't make me watch the third or fourth movies in the series.

reviews.review_title: Deserves more credit than it's been given...
reviews.content: I watched this movie with my family last night, and I have to say that I disagree with a lot of the reviews on here. I have two daughters, 7 and 5, both of whom have seen the original Home Alone movie. Did it make a difference to our enjoyment of THIS movie? No.I encourage viewers to take this movie for what it is. A fun, family romp about a big communication error. Characters are likeable, there's plenty of laughs and "hug your loved ones" moments and it certainly kept my little ones entertained!Anyone hoping to relive the original Home Alone movie should simply watch the original. As a standalone movie, we were very satisfied and my girls are hoping to watch it again.

reviews.review_title: I feel like butters when he said he likes Indiana Jones and the crystal skull
reviews.content: I am pondering if I should feel ashamed of myself for liking this movie.....I thought they had decent Easter eggs and paid homage to the original but maybe after reading all these reviews I'm left wondering if I'm broken.
Bad bad bad,horrible i dont know who idea was to make such a bad movie and ruin the classic,they bring back buzz mcallister and that did not save this movie.

reviews.review_title: I have never disliked a kid more
reviews.content: What is this, please tell me? Who is good guy, bad guy? Who are kids supposed to root for? Not only is the plot for this movie non-sensible, it put me in a bad mood. Nothing like 2 adults losing their house while having to put up with an obnoxious brother and horribly spoiled child to bring in the season of joy. Not even the cheesy, everyone is happy ending helps this. This is really, really bad movie.

Yes, the writers were paid for this absolute garbage...a couple in financial crisis during a holiday season wasn't painful enough so lets torture them even more... This is what 'COMEDY' has devolve into ladies and gentlemen.

Not sure why so much hate for this movie. Guessing most just see another Home Alone movie that isn't 1 or 2 and instant bad review.Put a new spin on original. Would rank them Home Alone 2, Home Alone, Home Sweet Home Alone, Home Alone 3, 4 and 5 are garbage.

reviews.review_title: No bad guys, kid was not cute at all either
reviews.content: Where to even begin? At least the 3rd one without Macaulay was decent, had a cute kid, really bad guys, high stakes, clever stuff done. There were no clever traps, nothing cool about the kid, nothing cute about him, his family was pathetic, the main characters after him were pathetic and not bad guys. So there really were no stakes, just a moronic couple trying to rob a suburban mansion unsuccessfully. Really truly not worthy of the name Home Alone, Do not watch this, let this die and be forgotten.

In the previous movies, you have an evil duo attempting to hurt an innocent kid. They use obvious comedic booby traps. This movie, a down and out family trying to get their property back are terrorized by a spoiled rich brat. The "hero" even tries to steal toys from a church meant for needy kids. Now in fairness, why the down and out couple doesn't do the mature thing and talk to the kids parents instead of resorting to theft, but they are not trying to hurt the kid. The traps the kid uses is often horrifying. This is not a fun movie and I actually found myself rooting for the "bad guys". This will not be added to my annual Christmas play list.
Weird movie. I rooted for the robbers more than the brat. Instead of the touching mother/son story the original had we barely saw the mom. Also, Kevin left his house livable...

Missing the bad guys. Missing All the funny accidents from 1. 2. And 3. Also do not get the mother and kid thing right. This is a Disney movie you can skip.Do not watch this. See the originals movies. And let's hope Disney learn something about remaking legendary movie.

For me it is mind-boggling, what makes actors agree to take part in such terrible garbage, knowing the original. Is paycheck they get really worth damaged reputation? All those stupid, mindless, farting jokes that make no sense?What a terrible end for once fun series.

I sat down to watch this with my 9yo with very low expectations. I soon found myself putting my phone down and watching it. I grew up with the originals and they were and are among my favorite Christmas movies so again, I was skeptical. It was very clever and did not spoil the magic of the originals for me at all. I only wish they were able to get more of the original actors for cameos. I found it hilarious and if Harry and Marv watch this in prison they will definitely be wincing in pain!

Don't even think of spending any money on this movie, one of the worst movies ever. Everything is bad about it. The storyline, the characters, the acting... this is a guideline how not to make a movie.

Okay, I went in with an open mind and a low judgement mental state, so I wasn't expecting much from it and wanted to give it an honest ta god fair shot which I did.I'm judging it like I judge any movie I watch.And to be honest with you, it wasn't bad, but it wasn't good, the whole thing was smack dab in the middle.There weren't any funny moments, everyone and everything felt like It was trying too hard.So it didn't really invoke any strong emotions from me as a viewer, I just sat there watching, with slight disappointment with certain scenes.They even pulled an X-men apocalypse by having a character judge reboots/remakes by saying that they never beat the original , so why even try?So yes Disney why did you even try? 🤔And the "villains" were just a couple down on their luck, so it wasn't funny to see bad things happen to them, especially since it was all due to a misunderstanding.Who thought that was funny? A couple getting severely hurt over and over all because they just want to save their home.The misunderstanding does get resolved and no one goes to jail, and they all live happily ever after.I'm skimming a little on some parts but that's because it wasn't important and it's just gonna be me telling you how it felt force and wasn't entertaining.In conclusion home alone sweet home alone is very low on the mildly entertaining scale with nothing much to really offer.The acting was okay, he dialogue wasn't much and there was only one scene that managed to make me chuckle.If you want to watch it go for it, but I can't guarantee you'll like it, especially if you watched the original and see just how much it is a rehash of it with some tweaking in a lot of uncreative ways.

reviews.review_title: Pretty good. Hard to live up to the first 2!
reviews.content: Watched this with the kids last night. Interesting twist on the original premise. Kids cracked up at the main break in sequence. Some nice family stuff. Lower expectations maybe and watch with an open mind. Love seeing Rob Delaney in anything.

I like this movie. Yes, he is not the same as with Macaulay Culkin and he was written off from him, but still he is better than some parts of the movie "Home Alone". People are already cruel and this film is not so that people would scoff at it, and in general, it's a Christmas holiday, no matter how, and it should cause joy, not fury, that one has restarted at home in the world and there are so many problems. People this is a film and I agree that it will not replace the very first "Home Alone", but let it at least become a little joy for someone), even if not for a long time)

I walked out on Austin Powers... if it wasn't for Ellie Kemper, I would've turned it off sooner! The kid is a 0, he was a thief, and he should've gotten payback. Instead of that, they let a little brat lead the way.

There are many things wrong with this film but the fundamental issue is the lack of a villain.Parents attempting to take back something that was stolen from them in order to save their home don't deserve to be tortured.
The acting ..is soooooooooooo bad the .entire movie is cringe. I laughed once. My kids liked it. If your watching as an adult drink plenty of booze first because this one sober is gonna hurt.

This is the worst movie EVER! I thought all the Home Alone movies were pretty cute. Max is a spoiled brat and the "robbers" are people who are just trying not to lose their house. The whole time I was rooting for them, not the kid (again who's a spoiled brat). Ugh, so mad I wasted my life watching this.

reviews.review_title: Bad videos ever, very boring i watch this movie

reviews.content: I'm reading these reviews and almost none of them are constructive. This is actually a decent movie and I'll tell you why. It's the most original one besides the very first movie. The protagonist isn't a protagonist at all. Also, after reading some of the reviews, people seemed to look over Buzz being in the movie. That's actually Buzz from the first movie. That's a great nod to the first one. If some of y'all have done your homework, you'd know that the original robbers will not reprise their roles regardless of pay.This movie is hilarious. The comedy is gold. The dad in this movie is outstanding and the shining light. It's not hard to put your negativity aside and watch with an open heart. This movie blows Home Alone 3, 4 and 5 out of the water. No doubt about that. There's nothing wrong with giving a bad score. But without constructive criticism and just spewing hate because of the dislike is not a review at all. It's just someone being upset in their lives enough to trash a movie for no reason.

reviews.review_title: Who's the good guy or who is the bad guy here?
reviews.content: While many movie sequels have destroyed franchises, this one almost does it. The whole essence of the prequels have been destroyed by a pathetic attempt to blur the line between a protagonist and antagonist. In the prequels, the audience supported the kid because he was teaching the bad guys a lesson and it felt they deserved the painful punishment meted out to them by Kevin (and the other kid in part 3). But while watching this, I actually felt bad for the couple and that made the scenes so UNFUNNY! And what's worse, there was no sympathy for kid as a result.So the thieves aren't really thieves and the kid is not the innocent little protagonist we felt connected with in the prequels.Also, there was very little done by the actors to bring any authenticity to the story. The mother's reaction to knowing that her kid was home alone half way across the world didn't really feel like a mother's reaction and felt too made up. In the prequels (parts 1 & 2) the mother's struggle and journey to reunite with her kid was a side story that added so much depth to the story. But this one was pretty light and felt forced fit.They have tried to characterize everyone as good but ended us doing a lot of harm not only to the movie but to the entire franchise!

reviews.review_title: A sad reflection of modern remakes
reviews.content: In the first movies you could laugh at the main antagonists in the film getting hurt, they were bad guys, career criminals with violent intentions for the child 'home alone'. In this latest incarnation we have desperate parents who are trying to save their home, one who is out of work and shows signs of depression being tortured by an unlikeable brat as they try to recover their valuable property that the horrid little s*@t stole in the first place.Depressing on a number of levels.

Obviously, the original two with Macaulay Culkin where the best most iconic movies, so don't even compare those movies with this new one.I think the perspective on this one was new and interesting because you want to "side" with the criminals since they're good people; they just wanted their expensive doll back that was supposedly stolen buy the main kid, Max. In the beginning, Max isn't that much of a likable character to the audience unlike the original Kevin, so it was harder to watch. And the couple was ok, but they annoyed me because of how dumb and immature they were even though they were supposed to be the humble adults.I thought the cameo of Buzz was funny, and they were even making fun of the movie because they said something like "why make a remake, the original is always better" or something like that. The music is familiar and there's a lot of Home Alone references in it which is cute.The iconic booby trap scene didn't have a lot of build up to it, it just felt kind of meh and wasn't OMG. Wasn't as exciting, but they couldn't make the traps that deathly in the movie because the "criminals" are good people.Overall, this movie would be good for younger kids to watch with the family. The younger generation would understand the jokes more because there's some weird "trendy" humor in it.

Worst plot i've ever seen, it just makes no sense and there is no comedic value for kids. Please just watch the first two movies because these are embarrassing to the franchise and i don't see why we needed another one when there is already like 5.

Bad actors and a bad storyline. The worst comedy movie ever. I don't want to spoil the film, but this storyline contains many details that disrespect the older people from a young rich kid. The old seasons was funny and had a good moral, but not this movie. This is not a good movie for kids and Christmas either.

Awful cliche, forcing the jokes and failing miserably , only nice thing about it is the presence of Buzz Mccallister , and the other connections to Home Alone saga, but don't get confused it doesn't have anything to do with Macaulay Kulkin movies.

Where to start? From the completely wooden delivery from the unlikable Kevin replacement to the poorly rehashed story and overly on the nose 'call backs', everything about this film deserves purging from societies collective memories asap.
One of the worst comedies ever. Just everything is bad, could almost finish to watch the movie. The idea is poor, the boy I would say it's sadistic. Never had a party, which would be funny.

reviews.review_title: C'mon people, have you ever seen the hot garbage hallmark cranks out?
reviews.content: Firstly, we didn't head into this expecting the charm and wit of the first 2 films...uhhh have you seen the last 2 before this one?...painful at best. This is a straight to streaming interesting twist on a very familiar idea that really does capture the spirit of holiday shenanigans that would just never happen in real life. It is very heavily coated with Disney flakes and deep fried in the very best trite oil available. But. It's super cute and truly entertaining if you hide your snooty-cinephilesque opinion neatly under the tree for an hour and a half. Our 7 year old loved this too. It's completely non-threatening, decently acted, smartly written, you don't have to think about it much, and you just have to enjoy it for what it is-an adorable and saccharine holiday movie that is gently kissed by the first 2 movies in the franchise but really would just rather stay inspirational friends instead of taking it any further. So just watch it. It's more fun than Tiktok and won't make your soul feel like a scorched and barren wasteland.

reviews.review_title: I don't know what anyone was thinking with this
reviews.content: It's a movie that tries to make the villains, people and just makes everyone a terrible person, just for an anti climactic ending, qnd for the bulk of it, it just feels like a terrible rich kid bullying a couple of poor people.

At most it seemed like poor copy of the original movie. Until the moment the kid was left on his own and started to dress up in adults clothes. Of course he put on a female dress and did like it. Not normal, never will be.

To begin, since Disney had acquired 20th Century Fox Studio's rights, it means that they made their reboot of the classic movie from 1990 Home Alone. This complete classic has been disrespected by this poorly directed movie adaptation. The plot makes no sense since the structure of it is a mess. It is a mess thanks to the characters, who are different actors but basically the same roles, but the classical roles had been slightly changed because now the main protagonist kid is not Kevin anymore, it's Max, who is a lot more irritating and evil which is not part of the classic role that people, including me, are looking for as a "replacement" for Kevin. Not to mention the bad guys are NOT bad at all, they are not the evil on this movie since they only want to save their home by selling a super duper valuable toy who is conventionally there just right in the moment when the main protagonist visit their home and gets missing, making the whole plot of the movie just an inconvenience between a kid and 2 grown up adults making terrible choice that could get them arrest. So the whole entire plot is a waste of time and does not engaged you since you know what would happen by just saying "mmm, they would know that Max didn't steal it". But the scene doesn't save this movie to the end, it's painful to watch an evil kid "defending his home" from this 2 grown up adults who could easily tell Max "HEY, DID YOU STOLE THAT ONE TOY THAT COULD SAVE OUR ECONOMIC LIFE" and Max could easily said "NOPE" and the 2 grown up adults could go figure, but this is sincerely a waste of time since you know everything is alright and just boring jokes and scenes past by, making the story completely irrelevant.
Horrible acting & story! Why is this family British? 😂They gave zero effort to make this a decent Home Alone!Writing to complete character requirements. Need more characters it seems!

I couldn't have disliked the little boy more!! Horrible spoilt little brat who can't act. What was the point of this movie?? My only hope was that he actually got arrested at the end for theft and assault and was put in some form for institute for the next 10 years. Truly awful! Avoid at all costs and hopefully we never see that boy again.

reviews.review_title: I created an account just to rate this movie...
reviews.content: The writers need a introductory course on Story by Robert McKee. Heck, I would buy them the book!The protagonist commits an infraction with the theft of property from the antagonists. In an attempt to retrieve the stolen item, by the protagonist, the audience is forced to assume the offended couple is the "bad guy/girl" of the film. This is fundamentally problematic as it causes a lack of care for both the protagonist and antagonists. The protagonist commits an infraction, therefore the audience finds no sympathy for the bratty kid who is not charming nor comedic. The antagonists seek to retrieve the item to sell for the sake of saving their house due to the loss of employment by the data migration manager. There is an attempt to sympathize with the antagonists for their lifestyle situation. In the end, rather than creating a basic storytelling mechanic of character delineation and development, the characters are flattened into individuals that no one in the audience would care for. The actors merely reflect the writers failure to develop and delineate. The actors themselves were not bad they were given garbage writing and directing. A waste of family time.Apparently Disney has money to waste...

From the poor acting to the stupid plot it was so unenjoyable. The only things I enjoyed were the editing and the pacing which was decent but do the writers understand that the reason why the original home alone films are so iconic are mostly due to the satisfaction of the ACTUAL villains getting what they deserved? These were people trying to save their family... It felt wrong and I was surprisingly routing for them.

10-year-old Max (Archie Yates) is left alone at home after the family, hurriedly going to Japan for Christmas holidays, forgets to take him with them. At the same time, a married couple Pam and Jeff (Ellie Kemper and Rob Delaney) break into the boy's house to return a rare and expensive doll, which, according to the intruders, Max took. The boy believes that the robbers did not come for antiques, but for him, so he equips the house with a lot of traps and repels criminals.Chris Columbus' dilogy, which tells about young Kevin and his exciting adventures with robbers, still remains an indispensable Christmas attribute. It is worth saying that even the most loyal viewer does not risk reviewing the "Home Alone" franchise beyond the second film: from the inventive Hollywood comedy, the tapes about Kevin were increasingly turning into television trash, which clearly marked the border between good and bad taste. Therefore, the new version, staged by Dan Mazer, deliberately signed itself up for a strange, largely inglorious existence. Directly continuing the unsuccessful experience of the fifth film with the subtitle "Holiday Robbery", the Maser tape came straight to the TV screens - quite in the tradition of "One House", which for us has always remained a home pleasure, tied to the New Year holidays and a lazy January weekend.

reviews.review_title: What a massacre of an old classic
reviews.content: What a terrible script, how can the writer make such a nice couple in to villains. The new Kevin couldn't be more annoying. I suffered trough the hole movie and regretted watching it after it was over. What a massacre of an old classic. Too bad!

The kid is super annoying and the plot is terrible. The main character, is so obnoxious that you're actually rooting against the kid. The "bad guys" aren't even bad. I feel bad that those two actors subjected themselves to such bad roles. They just want what was already theirs in the movie. I watched the first twenty minutes of this atrocious movie and couldn't handle any more. I already had low expectations for this movie and somehow it was worse than I thought it would be. If I could give this movie 0 stars, I would. Just stick to the first 2 Home Alone movies - the classics. Heck even Home Alone 3 was 10 times better than this one.

reviews.review_title: Was this teaching how NOT to make a movie?
reviews.content: There must be a reason why someone would want to pen such a horrible story. The absence of joy in the plot may have been due to the fact that the protagonist seemed like the kind of person the readers wouldn't want to support. I felt sick to my stomach the whole time watching the film because the antagonists were constantly challenged (even mentally) and had to endure the misery that comes with being misunderstood. If we were going to watch a Home Alone movie, we just assumed that the child is the protagonist and the invaders are the antagonists. Maybe, the writers meant to do it the opposite way around on this remake to become original. However, the actors couldn't get into character because of the script's fixation on overacting.How the makers of Home Sweet Home Alone thought they could recapture the spirit of Home Alone is beyond me even there was a cameo and some moments very similar to the original Home Alone movie. The story's characters almost made me feel so bad that I almost decided I didn't want to see another film made from the United Kingdom ever again. In the end, I came to the conclusion that the film was intentionally made as a teaching tool for those learning the art of filmmaking to exhibit how NOT to write a movie.

I'm rooting for the 'burglars' in this movie.It's literally just a film about a privileged british child torturing two lower class parents trying to receive something that the kid STOLE from THEM. They try to excuse it by saying the kid thinks they're gonna basically human traffic him or something, but this kid is literally a psycho.The best parts of the movie would just be the cameo of buzz and callbacks to the original movie. Some moments are funny but god i wanna punt this kid so bad. They say kevin mccalister was like jigsaw? This kid beats him by tenfold. He shoots the female burglar with at least twenty nerf bullets with needles attached. It's terrifying.

You wanna wanna know how mad this movie is, I didn't even watch all of it, I watched the trailer and the first 10 mins that's it. The acting is horrible, the jokes aren't funny, they used the exact same plot as the original home alone there wasn't any creativity in the whole plot in this move. On top of using the same exact plot they use a lot of the same sayings and dialogue. They should've just brought back the original cast and made a new movie and had Macaulay Culkin leave his kids at home. I don't understand why they keep making new home alone movies when the only movies that were good and did well were the original two. I know the 3rd one gets a lot of hate but compared to the other ones I think it's better than 4,5,6. Save yourself your time and don't watch this movie.
